zQKIma14U6Gq5dfJnQQiBQ.text: Ughhhh so GROSS. Why did we waste our time and money coming here? Honestly do not waste your time or stomach

ctpQ56kMiP-ZJ4FaiC-uzA.text: Long lines and waiting time for starters. They need to modernise or expand. Great for a budget or pit stop run in Vegas!

J4WrdTOMdHfbeOBiUN5xuA.text: I'm definitely a fan of this buffet, especially for the price.  Since it's in Downtown Vegas (and away from the strip), even the dinner prices are excellent.  The buffet was approx. $35 for dinner and soft drinks, juices and water are included.  The booze was cheap, also, so worth getting if you want a bucket of beer or something.  Sure, this is The Golden Nugget, which isn't as fancy as the Strip casinos and hotels, but it's great in its own vintage, nostalgic sort of way.  The buffet was large and offered tons of stuff from pizza to soup to fresh carved meats to salads.  Obviously, tons of sides available like mashed potatoes, veggies, breads, rolls, etc.    I thought the food was tasty.  I've been to better, more upscale buffets, sure, but this place was good and the food was well-made.  There was no trouble getting in and we didn't wait long at all to be seated.  Drink service was quick and no complaints about the servers.  I'd go back again and I recommend you do, as well, since this is one of the better buffets on Fremont Street (at least from what I've heard).

DZ_AthRRe5WBMdfcYPlo1g.text: The quality of the food offered here is far from exceptional, but there is a pretty good variety available at a reasonable price-- especially for a Las Vegas buffet.  I was kinda surprised to see so many overwhelmingly negative reviews of the Golden Nugget Buffet here on Yelp.  Maybe these folks went in expecting gourmet restaurant quality meals made to order, but with the convenience and price of an inexpensive buffet.  Personally, I didn't have particularly high expectations for a high-volume chow trough on top of a casino.  We ate here twice in a row during our stay at the Nugget: a weekday lunch ($13) and weekend Champagne Brunch ($19, +a $5 surcharge for 'gratuity' as we were part of a larger group).  Both meals were hit-and-miss: fresh fruits, salads, made to order omelettes, and some of the side dishes were great, but pizza, pasta, and several other items were bland and/or incredibly greasy.  This is why variety is key; if one item is crap just get something else!  Lots of desserts to choose from, too.  For some reason the process of getting patrons into the dining area was ridiculously slow, but once inside the service was good-- especially when it came to providing mimosa refills during the champagne brunch!  I wouldn't go out of my way to come back here, but if I were staying at the Nugget again I'd probably do the buffet again just because of it's convenience and relatively good value.

H32YCfj2geF-F3n2tt9ufw.text: I stopped by here this past Sunday morning with my fiance for the Champagne Brunch.  We were staying at the casino and after looking at the menu saw that the brunch was reasonably priced at $19.99, at least as far as Champagne brunches in Vegas go.  The inside of the restaurant looked very clean, had a view of the new pool area out of the window and did not have very much decor to speak of.  The food here was actually pretty good.  It had your standard omelet making station as well as other brunch favorites like eggs benedict and blintzes.  Beyond that they also had a little seafood area with peel and eat shrimp and crab salad, a Chinese food section, salad bar and carving station.  The servers here also kept the mimosa's coming.  Half of my flute probably got filled up 10 times or so while I was sitting there.  They start you off with a flute of it and then have a server walking around with pitchers of it who top you off.  This may go towards the fact that I ate a buffet the night before but I think that my favorite part of the meal was the ceasar salad that I made and then topped with chick peas and beets.  The bottom line for me is that I would probably stop by here again in the future.  The food was pretty good and the servers did an excellent job of keeping the mimosas full which is one of the best parts of a Champagne Breakfast.

Psv_3aEpeDQZgQsl51UwlA.text: I remember one of my co-workers telling me about how sucky this buffet was and I was worried about eating here, but since it was for a family reunion and I didn't have a say in where to eat - we had to eat here.  It sucked.   The selections were limited and if it looked good, it wasn't.   The only 2 good things that were good about this place was: one, It got all 30ish of my family members together and two, our waiter was very nice and patient with all of us.

VWIWyZGFTlxyoqU07DTFCg.text: We went for the lunch buffet. Not too many options for vegetarians or kids.  The dessert section was very appealing. For the money definitely a great choice

zy5A82Xqc1vSE-_U3zr1FA.text: Also the only buffet I would eat downtown. Waitstaff if they weren't over the top friendly they seemed bothered. The cooks really made me feel like I was bothering them. Really your job is to cut me Roast beef sorry its so tough you need a chainsaw to get through it not my fault. All in all pretty crappy. I tried it 3 times breakfast, lunch, and dinner gross, grosser, grossest guess I wasn't drunk enough. What really sucks is unless you want to have a $100 meal or a .99cent shrimp cocktail that was the best option. Very disappointed

PRWiNXYLig9R3HMIi0bT3w.text: The food is pretty good. The ice cream bar is where it's at. Raspberry sorbet and orange sorbet. Seated a group of 16 for us. Some of the staff was a little rude but we didn't interact with them for long. The servers are nice and quick to clean the table for you.

ehAv-SOXX-x2flkdINFpbg.text: good deal and best lunch buffet on Fremont. Received great service from Frank! will definitely be back just for all the great desserts

WzLcGIxdJYR3UKMY36GlJw.text: Very small selection, very high prices, very cold food, very disappointed...  I would suggest paying a little bit more and heading down to the strip and visiting one of the main casinos where you will have a better selection and be more satisfied.

0gBTvSqovsq5u3fhP0T35Q.text: Food not as good as the nationwide chain Golden Corr**, selection very lacking, staff neutral to slightly unfriendly.  Been to five buffets this week and all have been better including Main Street St****.

OPqe5zscXv2ccYSj4dLjsQ.text: The price was a little more than expecting but everything else was amazing! The staff was super friendly and always checked in on us, we had 5 plates and desert plates we couldn't stop eating! Most buffets don't get it right with all the food but this place was amazing, everything was the right texture and taste and nothing had been sitting out to long, would recommend to anyone! After eating we were happy with Price due to the experience we had.

9UydknnhsQiuGM97CVD14w.text: Excellent Breakfast Buffet.  Service was quick, Restaurant was clean and neatly set up.  Food selection for a bufett I thougtht was limited but the taste of the items I ate was absolutely delicious.  If the cost was a little cheaper I would have rated it "five stars".

qCBjtbA_-mp6K3L839902A.text: Not at all that good for the price you pay.  I figured I was gonna get a ton food near the buffet but damn was I wrong. I was extremely disappointed with the food that they have. It was very limited. I can go to other local buffet spots in Vegas and get a more solid deal with a variety of choices that you want to eat.

eW0XEPSSQl85jFi3gm7ziw.text: We stayed at the GN hotel from 09/08-09/11 and we were very disappointed with their buffet. The selection was not a big selection at all. We are their one time during our stay and went to other places the remainder of our time.

64VBYJVjJ9t3M307W2rsyA.text: Enjoyed breakfast and dinner during my stay. They offer a good variety of your typical buffer food options on both. The food was tasty. I particularly enjoyed their Saturday night Bar-b-que theme. My boyfriend was expecting crab legs and was told the discontinued all weekend and now have them only on Friday night. The pricing was average for an overpriced tourist casino unless you eat your fill on a buffet. The serving staff is not friendly and provide mediocre service during both experienced thus the 3 stars and not 4. Great option if staying in hotel and want an onsite dining venue.

6Zr38ce-jn7PQcrxzswOzA.text: There's hardly any wait time. Most to all of the staff are friendly. There's a good selection of food, but wasn't flavourful. Everything was really bland for costing so much.

3qXr7FTKieMbk7UbGLxQsw.text: It was ok pretty much just like any other buffet nothing special no one went out of their way to make anything good the service was really bad I didn't get my drinks refilled. I can't really say good or bad but for 20 bucks I really expect more. The mayonnaise was yellow and everything just seems like it was pre cooked and slaughtered with sauce. They have a 24 hour omelet buffet. I really like the fruit torte. Other than that just the regular spot.

1X6xsDtjwviIKXzMO9M_sQ.text: U can go pay 25 plus doallars per person,on,a buffet on, the strip or spend 12 for lunch here and gett the same thing...up to u.   ok so its a little different lol but in reality me and my wife spent about 60 dollars the day before for lunch and today we spent 24 and we got just as full so you take your pick. it was good

hqBQoGZwmcpss1SQ_Jy-uQ.text: I was here on 8/11/2011 Love the food  great especially the made to order pasta. Deserts were wonderful. Sushi seemed a bit dry. Ate here on a Tuesday night for 18.99/person.

p1aK06Dm_aZNQGeIi0CC1A.text: If I could give it 0 stars I would. We got there around 8ish it wasn't supper crowded...now we know why. It's 21.99 for the seafood and more buffet (the only one for dinner they offer)...I was expecting at least some quality seafood. Nope! Literally they cold shrimp, muscles, and oysters. They were suppose to be on ice but they were in mostly water and looked like it had been out for 4-5 hours (not appetizing). The line was 10-15 minutes to just get to the seafood part. They had very minimal selection of pretty much everything. The food was Bland and needed salt. I seriously will not be going back. For 5 dollars more go to the rio....a way better selection for a little bit more!

7ewaThmu4coew4soRa9fHQ.text: We went to the buffet for breakfast and I was not really all that hungry, I scanned around to see what all they had to offer, I saw the normal breakfast works, I settled on an egg omelet with mushrooms, jalapenos, ham and peppers with cheese (which was good) and grabbed some hash browns, went to go for the pancakes but saw there was no syrup, and I love me some pancakes with my syrup so I didn't get any, but found out later from friend that they had it in a corner, who knew. I sat down with my food and our waiter came up to the table an asked if we needed anything I asked for Coffee and OJ, man he rolled his eyes and gave tude, like he was too good to wait on our table and that's just kind of how the entire meal went with him, was at the point of not wanting to ask for anything. Then went to check out the desert bar and saw eclairs and cream puffs (luv me some cream puffs) and coconut macaroons, was very disappointed with the cream puff the dough was hard and edible, the eclair and macaroons however were delish. If I'm ever back in Vegas I don't think I will make it back to the buffet. I'm going to have to pass.

ToZS4yeM6O4M8hQ9P9CA4w.text: It was good. Went here for breakfast.  I  liked that they had a smoked salmon and bagel fixins area.   We didn't have to wait in line at all on a Sunday morning. It wasn't a gigantic buffet but they had everything I wanted.  Not sure they shoulda charged $20 a person---$15 prolly more appropriate but whatev.

yesPBtR_Vnghd8rfSNQ63A.text: Nothing fancy.  But it serves it's purpose.  Went here 3 times on our recent visit.  First was last Friday after we checked in and got settled.  Came early for the seafood buffet.  Granted, there should have been more seafood.  But there was just enough of a selection to stuff ourselves silly.  Snow crab legs(whole and still attached to the center of the crab), shrimp, and a Cajun steamed bag of prawns, some pieces of crab thrown in along with a piece of corn on the cob and some yummy spicey sausage.  The crab was good and sweet, the Cajun basket was awesome.  And of course there were other meats there like pork and a sad piece of meat they claimed was prime rib.  Which I consider to really be the only thing wrong with this buffet.  There was plenty of bunny food options too, fruits tons of carb dishes, and of course dessert.  Lots of dessert options and the right size since you should already be stuffed by then.  The Creme Brulie is yummy! Lunch, we got there as they were trying to transform from breakfast to lunch.  Missed out on the bacon.  But the omelet station went on through the lunch serving while we were there.  So score on that.   Breakfast was delicious.  The waffles are small but don't let that fool you.  They are so fluffy on the inside.  Omelets, get an omelet.  There a couple different areas for the eggs and each one is a little different.  One is plain, one with cheese, and one that has bell peppers and ham mixed in.  And like someone said before, check your coupons once you check in.  m-f is 2 for one at breakfast or lunch.  So if you are only here for the weekend, they are no use to you but if you are on a longer trip like we were, those coupons help stretch those stripper dollars you worked so hard to save up!

bniKA7DeTu3Hi2gz-IxV8w.text: didnt like it. i thought because it was the golden nugget that it would be realy great, saddly it wasnt. there wasnt alot to chooes from and the hot food wasnt even hot, bearly warm is more like it. and if you like salad, dont bother coming here either it all looked like nobody put any though into the food, just kinda slaped a few styles together and called it a buffet. deffentaly not worth the $18.99

E6rMPErf8mTY1Od7Az7PiA.text: On Monday the 7th, we had the 2nd best service (thanks to Kristin at the Hideout) of our trip. The hostess was friendly, nice and went out of her way for us even though we "look like trouble". The selection was great and our waiter was excellent as well. Thanks.

4XYHlmCv4_ce3-4G9blKSA.text: We stayed at the Golden Nugget so naturally we thought we would give their buffet a shot.  Terrible idea....When we first walked in we were not impressed at all.  The decor was tacky, screamed old people, country kitchen.  The selection was not the best.  Paid like $18.00 for champagne brunch.  My husband had some fried chicken which was extremely dry.  I opted for the chicken fried steak, which after one bite, was the worst chicken fried steak I have ever tasted!  It tasted like something from my old high school cafeteria.  We immediately went and got our money back.  We then took a cab to the Treasure Island buffet.  It was better, but still not great.  I am starting to think the Vegas Buffet idea is over hyped!

IIv8IxNwd-0chRZTg0NfZA.text: really good buffet. alot to choose from. our waitress was really attentive and taking good care of us. i will return next time i come to vegas!

Gvvl8dNdTC0ffYwazXcPkA.text: Worst buffet in Las Vegas.  $23 will get you a limited selection of small, dried out seafoods; way-oversalted cooked dishes and stale out-of-the-box desserts.  There are so many other places in town where you can get a much better quality dining experience for less.

6meSZHptQa5bG5EjFCQo5w.text: This was one of the more of the expensive buffets I had in Vegas, $21 a person dinner on Monday and it just wasn't that good.  Just down the street at 4 Queens we had a great meal for $9.

-TJ0J8CijcxUAIWcxFph-w.text: Bread pudding with bourbon sauce is great! Avoid everything else. Elementary school cafeteria quality food.

NxTwPrFu0An-sW0E-DNpUA.text: 40 bucks for a below par buffet for 2.  Everything was overcooked.  Our server was attentive.  And refilled our drinks and got us what we asked for.  I think that we may have been early for the dinner service, but overall it wasn't a great dinning experience.

K1GhYFi9zmims25U4JP5qg.text: Worst buffet ever! Very high priced and very low quality.  Family from out of town visited and took us there. The only thing positive any of us could say was, 'Nice decore".  Stay away.

wgGe3Oh-v6f7yDRmDcHAoA.text: Meh food, selection, cleanliness. Good price, though, and nice view and service.

YcCyCKBhmLqq5U2_cdFa1g.text: This buffet just somehow does not work.  I ate breakfast and it was average lunch ditto and supper same.  They had this huge round of roast beef at dinner.  I had a slice it was so tough I could not cut it with my knife.  The other meat on the carving station was baby back ribs.  The ribs were better than average.  The salad selection was limited but very good.  The Greek Salad was very tasty.  The dessert  section was big but I don't do the sugars so I could not tell you how they tasted.  I did scope out the bread pudding for a friend of mine Stephanie in St. Louis just on the maybe she would eat here.  Stephanie the bread pudding was average sorry.  The two stars is the parent company that owns this should know better.  When the Golden Nugget buffet was under the old management it was head and shoulders above this one.  That is just not right..  They charge enough money to put better food out.  I just don't know why they won't step up to the plate.  For goodness sake Main Street Station is better as is the Paradise at the Fremont.

jicQEudBgFqjtJ658o2P4A.text: We were pretty disappointed this this buffet.  Like the user below, we couldn't find a review on Yelp, but Frommer's rated it pretty good so we decided to give it a try while we were checking out Downtown Las Vegas.  This buffet is severely lacking and overpriced in my opinion.  The selection was weak, the sushi was absolutely terrible and the roast beef carving station I tried was dry dry dry.  The desserts were also really disappointing.  The only reason I'm giving it two stars is because our waitress was actually really nice and prompt and they serve full size ice cream scoops on sugar cones. For being one of the 'nicer' hotels in Downtown Las Vegas, I was expecting more.  Will definitely never go back.

LysbOMhVGsfZGDG0w3WrmQ.text: The crab legs were really good and get 4 stars. They serve both hot and seasoned crab legs. I also liked the Shrimp boil. HOWEVER, the rest of the buffet was not good, so overall rating is lower. BUT $21 for good crab legs is alright by me and I would eat here again.

8YRMDHQCj9vv3mLczUnf1g.text: I've been coming to the Golden Nugget for fifteen years, and have seen the changes it's gone through. While I approve of moving the buffet upstairs to its new updated area, the buffet itself has really suffered. This used to be a four star buffet in food quality, service, and layout. Now it rates a two.  The layout of the buffet is such that the omelets and carving lines block access to most of the hot dishes. The selection of fresh fruit us limited to cantaloupe only, there is no shrimp or crab at lunch. As a matter of fact, the only thing they have a passable assortment of is desserts.  The quality of the food has also dropped substantially. Dried out turkey, pressed canned ham, and soup from a can is not what I want to eat. If this is their idea of good food, I know that I am not going to try one of the nicer, more expensive restaurants. Why throw good money after bad? I can't understand how a restaurant chain can take over a hotel casino and screw up the restaurant. The only reason I can give is that Landry's wanted to greatly increase their profit margin.

QJ0PiHu99pYlgU5ADpy4ZA.text: We came here on Thanksgiving Day where it cost $30 per person(already a bad start)But the line was well over 2 hours and there were many people cutting in the other "Elite Gamblers" line which seemed to move at a rapid pace while the regular line moved at a snail pace.(This was getting ridiculous) when we finally got seated(3 hours later).Me and my family were famished so we headed into the food line and where there's another long line of people waiting to get food.(FYI this was in the buffet not outside) and we found very little selection of a variety which is highly unseen in a Las Vegas casino.Thanksgiving feast consisted of Turkey and ham that is hard to chew,your teeth must be strong or your dentist will be very happy.The salad bar were stale vegetables and salad was pathetic.The only edible part of buffet was the dessert which was cake and ice cream.  Overall I'm underwhelmed by this overpriced and pitiful thanksgiving feast don't waste your money and time.I would prefer if you went to Palace Station,Fiesta or even Arizona Charlie's Decatur much better than this rich guy amusement park.

8NwFzRAQI9y1CgZ8eofMMA.text: Actually a very good buffet, with a great variety of items, wine is inexpensive, but dinner is pricey.  If I was downtown I would go to it but to drive to it no way. So if you are going to the Fremont experience or downtown try it, otherwise go to someplace closer.

MqVm6vjQZVvpFq4LGeMYxg.text: Me and my wife went for the breakfast buffet. They have good variety and the food quality is good for the price. There are other buffets in Las Vegas that are better but for the price of the Golden Nugget, I  was actually pleasantly surprised.

grEH27TLeeU15ay1gDW8QQ.text: If you love over salted greasy food and like to pay a premium for it... Well my friends then drop on in to the Golden nugget buffet.

kgYn8VU_3sAQpcRUf1zWSQ.text: For the high price this Buffett was a disappointment.  Food had been sitting on the Buffett and some the food appeared quite old. For a Buffett of this price, the food selection was quite limited.   On a positive note, restaurant staff were present, very helpful and provided good service.

TP9Q2iEqEa2WnX1aAnpVTg.text: When you've gone to other buffets that look like the buffet for the gods...this buffet easily would be disappointing to the eye. But with a fresh and open mind, they're just all right. Nothing spectacular or impressive. They are certainly cheaper than the buffet for the God's for common sense sake. The staff has always been ready and friendly. Felt like all my auntys were hard at work. Lo.  Overall, yeah...they're just all right. I'd recommend another buffet nearby but I don't think think I'm allowed to plug the other business's name. The food scene in downtown Las Vegas in recent years has stepped up for the good! I advise to try look into such places when looking for breakfast/lunch/dinner.   Enjoy!

ULSpGk2noGH8GaDxA4NX6g.text: Had a Wednesday night buffet. The $24 price for a buffet is a little high, but I think it was worth it. The atmosphere is bright and clean; the selections are numerous and varied, including both cold and warm food options. The desert bar was an amazing end to a good meal. Our waiter Phil also helped make it a great experience... Next time we stay downtown, one meal will definitely be here...

uk4Rn0ZwIykzy9kbAv5C1w.text: Golden Nugget buffet is definitely one of the originals.  Upon entering you feel the old world Vegas in the ambience, decor, the wait staff's uniforms.  Once seated, it is comfy and cozy.    The food choices are a good variety from hot to cold. The salad bar has great choices from lettuces, to toppings, to dressings. The pastry & dessert choices are phenomenal.    Service is really good from entering, being seated, waited on.  We're so glad to see that an original is still around serving goodness to the people.  Thank you Golden Nugget :))

NdkpnBGYwp1E73WidYbQbA.text: I really enjoyed the food and the service was fast and courteous. The variety of the food was nice and I enjoyed everything they had. Compared to other buffets, this wasn't the most fancy or diverse. However, I am a picky eater and I found that it was appealing to me. For the price, this is really delicious and great.

se_g9-TN1Yxfu2WHmCnXrQ.text: Everyone was very nice and the food was wonderful! Great service from Ms Elba and Thank you Ms Carol be being very nice with a great smile.  We will be back on our next trip

VrV32FWeHpLwizFKDUNalA.text: Food is neither hot fresh or tasty, even by buffet standards. The price is excessive for  a breakfast buffet, no matter how big an eater you will never get value for your money. The coffee tastes like dishwater.  Good wide selection but it all tastes bland. Egg station was the only good part. Terrible value for the price, even at half the price the quality is so poor I would not go back.

kl1JfSNP1Fbug3mBBQTcKQ.text: This buffet was by far the best we have had so far. Im not a sea food eater so I couldn't tell you how that was. Im judging based on the salad bar options. This was the only one with nuts (which I much prefer since I don't eat croutons) also a beautiful charcuterie spread with fresh fruits, pickled vegetables, an array of cheeses, parm crisps and cured meats and cheeses.

Glv69HcGR2UWsnk58uR3PQ.text: We almost didn't come because of some of he negative reviews we saw on Yelp  Well I'm so so glad we decided to give it a try The restaurant is very nice, the decor is a wonderful throw back to golden age of Vegas.    Reasonably priced Excellent service, our hostess could not have been any nicer, attentive or funnier.   She gets 10 stars  The food was excellent.  Great selection from the carving station to the omelette station to the pasta station to the mountain of fresh shrimp! The salad & fruit bar where stacked with delicious fresh fruit & vegetables.   The dessert station was delectable. We where pleasantly surprised and will be coming back.  This place is a gem on Fremont.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Nugget Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits, country gravy, chicken fried steak, mac &amp; cheese and bacon ....yum
Photo of Golden Nugget Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mouth watering carving station  The brisket was on point
Photo of Golden Nugget Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. For the sweet tooth in the group

n-4JuPjFuBmUw2zNvUSpMQ.text: My dining companion rated everything as awful. As this is not cheap I expected much better. The coffee tasted awful, sort of like soy sauce. Baked ham was strangely flavorless and country gravy disappointing. Collard greens and corned beef hash were the best of the lot. The staff was freindly and attentive but could not make up for the food.

nNCrLDqM2Ljq6O6rzUEYMw.text: Went to this buffet after my aunt's wedding and I was very impressed. Since we were a large group of 40 they reserved us a space near the buffet. The service by our two waitresses were awesome. They quickly came and took our drink orders and were so nice!   The food selection was amazing. There was a huge selection of prepared meats, salads, pastas, and vegetables. There was a mix of Italian, Mexican, Mediterranean, Soul Food, and Asian flavors in the buffet. So, if you had a particular type of food that you liked you could find it or vice-versa. I loved that they had a deli bar with a fresh selection of meat and cheeses. I was able to add some cheese to these flavorful beans and sausage soup that I had--so delicious and the cheese just brought out more of the flavor! My plate was filled with a little bit of everything! I so wish I had a few extra stomachs or just more room in my one so I could have gone back a few more times. I am always a little unsure of buffets, but you could tell that the food was freshly prepared and put out for dinner time.   The dessert selection--no words to describe how it was. I have never seen such a great selection of desserts anywhere. They had everything from pies, cakes, cookies, cheesecake bites, ice cream,   The only thing is I wish that the buffet was a little less expensive. For it being off the strip and $25 it was a little pricey, but I feel it is worth for the most part because of the food selection and service. I would choose this spot if you are looking to get a dinner with a wide variety of options!

u01owZg1nL5Ehx9P6Yi_Xw.text: Not the largest buffet in Las Vegas, but everything was delicious & well-prepared. The prime rib was incredible, and I ate way more of the mashed potatoes and macaroni & cheese than I'd planned, because both were THAT good. I enjoyed the shrimp, too. And, the desserts were amazing as well! Our server was fantastically friendly & helpful... Neither my sweet tea nor water was ever empty. Plus, she and another server made sure we knew when the buffet was closing & we needed to make one last trip. The Golden Nugget offers a great dinner buffet at a great price!

Photo of Golden Nugget Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Nugget Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My first plate from the dinner buffet.

l09T0qW6EECpwxJHc6XOpw.text: If I could give a 0 star review I would. Very bad buffet and not a lot of options or stuff to eat.  Some of the food was even cold. Best part of buffet was the service the waiter gave us and leaving. Stay away!

2dFDfGYBbhWDzPDdm-rzkQ.text: The buffet was done very well. The restaurant at South was in very good condition and looked very appealing and clean. The wait staff was very professional, nice and accommodating for that extra steak knife. The only reason I would not rate this for five stars is because of the lack of rotation in the menu. As a guest at the hotel and meeting there multiple times I tended to desire something a little different.  Also stale Krispy Kreme Donuts should never be tolerated!  It is one of the cheapest dining options at the hotel and a very good value for your money. If you are looking for a very robust salad bar this is not the place for you. If you are looking for a very robust salad bar this is not the place for you. The desserts were excellent and home made. If you come on the weekend make sure that you are aware that the morning is brunch buffet only and is dinner time prices.

WjVNKUAHH1tOwiFO-fVs9w.text: Do not eat here! I went with my boyfriend today around 3:30.. And had a horrible experience!! All of the carving station meat was bone dry and un-edible! And thats not the worst part.. I was going to looked past the meat thing and tryed to get full off of the salad i had made myself but i had had it when i bit into a huge peice of tomato that litterally filled my mouth with rotten juice that tasted like decaying garbage.. I was completely disgusted i spit it out immediately and informed the manager. Her response was the meat seems over cooked thats all..a followed that up with "its a buffet"   She ended up refunding the money we paid, i was very let down because i was ready to eat and didnt have the highest expectations but i also didnt expect to be served bacteria ridden food.  Now i havent vomited but i do feel sick to my stomach and dizzy i pray i dont get food poisoning!

T6msgDeVt1bYYuM67N104g.text: Went here for brunch buffet. Nice decor and plate settings with a view. However the food options is pretty limited for brunch at least. Service was mediocre at best, but the Buffet itself has a grand feel to it!

V7BK4X1VD948zL3WrJgyWg.text: This place was awesome! Came here to eat on a Sunday (for brunch) with our friends. The food was excellent, loved the omelet guy- he was so funny. The corned beef hash, bacon, and everything I had was great! Also, we enjoyed the all you can drink Champagne! Our server was the best. I wish I could remember her name. She told us she was born and raised in LV, and she was hilarious and on top of things. Great place to eat and enjoyed the pool view too!

lXBWhrxCToBKrVvzTn_VJQ.text: Absolutely horrible. I'm no picky eater but I literally ate nothing beside there anti para salads. I was really disappointed with everything. The potatos au gratin were not even cooked!!! I only tasted a few desserts and decided to eat dinner else where. Thank god the casino comped this other wise I would have been pissed. If your looking for a good quality low price buffer,., it doesn't really exist in vegas anymore. You get what you pay for I guess.

CqUyK5sLX1hG15_dJAK5Nw.text: Came here during lunch and was able to stay until dinner. Good price/deal. I liked the selection of food.  Clean buffet and good service. I'm glad I came here. Will be back next time I'm in Vegas!

JUXtBYjYEorers_4lvckaQ.text: We used to go to this buffet pretty much every time we were in Vegas -- never again!  You'd think that a casino owned by a big, high-end food company would make an effort to make their buffet good.  Not here.  We went in on Sunday for brunch.  First, no champagne -- there always was in the past, but no more.  Now it's just overpriced, bad food with miserable and useless help.  I generally don't complain, but this was beyond the pale.  It was expensive and not worth the price at all.  the old Circus Circus buffet for $1.99 was way better.

S36WqFdNeF_fEIJQfCq3Jg.text: Out of the many buffets in Vegas, this one was pretty good.  I had a little bit of fruit, some vegetables, some pasta, some meat. I ordered a Sprite, which I could've got endless refills of if I had finished the 32 ounce cup. I didn't, but my friend did and he got free refills.  Because I went during spring break there were chocolate eggs and tie-dyed eggs dispersed all over the buffet for little kids to "hunt." That was a cute touch for families.  This place is good if you're on a budget and you're hungry.

v523NpDIP8A0FYpJvUHxsA.text: We went during the transition between breakfast and lunch (even though lunch started at 10:30 and we were there at 11 they still had breakfast items out). The biscuits were hard as a rock, the gravy had the consistency of water, and almost everything there was cold. The selection was poor at best. We would have been much happier spending a fraction of the money and eating at McDonald's.

DJ86HGl__XbbM_pt6SrvRg.text: Good prices unlimited crab leggs awesome omlet station and great customer service. A must stop for

tY40tVKEv4k0dZCR5XshkQ.text: Um.... for dinner, it's way overpriced for what they offer, which is really nothing.  The only thing I could really go for is the roasted chicken, because the roast beef was inedible.  I can't stand having to peel shrimp cocktail so I skipped on that.  I couldn't even go for the mexican food area because the guacamole looked like sour cream that turned green.  As for breakfast, it might be more worth it.  It's like around $11 and it's cheaper than if you go to the cafe right downstairs.  They have eggs benedict, but they overpoach the eggs... all of them.

4s-3YBsM9CoHo6Cj2_UmIQ.text: Not too bad! I came here one sunday because all they buffets on the strips had long lines. This place was Better than I expected. My gf enjoyed the oyster shooters. And the breakfast food wasn't all that bad. I went back for two or three plates. Selection was ok not as big as the stops buffets but also not as expensive.

FvdfGaJUFKUk5cKu61_F7w.text: Value, service, quality, choices, atmosphere... Meh.   That's it folks. Continue Yelping elsewhere.

eHsllDy7zLIVjum6ZNNleQ.text: Not bad, but not the greatest.  One thing I like is it's small, so much more manageable than other places.  Their fried chicken was pretty good.  They could do better with their selection of fresh fruit: canned pineapple?  Really?  Real pineapple isn't that expensive.  Do you just not want to spend the labor to cut it up?  How about a banana at least?  Also, while you can get all the grape tomatoes you want, there wasn't a sliced tomato in sight and I really wanted to make a BLT!  The carving station was decent, with a couple of kinds of sausage (the Andouille was pretty decent,) and the ham was good, but the turkey was dry, dry, dry.  Some other places offer fresh OJ, the OJ here is out of a bottle.  I understand you're going to cut some corners with a buffet, but I'd have been happier with a smaller glass of fresh (since the juice is not unlimited anyway...)

V63veTzmrDeWfAr1D6ripQ.text: If your reading this your probably in/from San Diego. If that's True then we have access to some of the best Buffet's in the country at our Reservation Gaming hotel/casino's. Golden Nugget Buffet is a far cry from even the mediocre buffets in San Diego. The crab legs were small, not as clean as I like. The oysters were dry, the prime rib was bland and dry. The shrimp was not peeled and the buttery fly fried shrimp was dry and hard as a rock. The server was nice and was at our service, but the initial sit down took a few extra minutes. For $28 I got a 2 star buffet, but back home I can get 5 stars for $22. The chairs were uncomfortable, but the drunk bachelorette party near us gave us ample entertainment.

tWwfL55TV4B1RVdAFmKbpg.text: Had their breakfast and brunch which wasn't bad but very pricey for what you get. Food was a decent selection and tasty for the most part but $10.99 for breakfast and $18.99 for brunch which is the same as breakfast with shrimp and mimosas. Staff was pleasant but better breakfast elsewhere and much better brunch at the Mirage for about the same scratch.

d3iAi050WoNctq0TmqDe_g.text: I was here 12/22-12/23/11, gotta give the buffet some credit, it was damn good.The food was tasty, and my fav def was the pizza and pasta. The price was great, considering I received a coupon upon check in for a buy one get one free, can't beat that...  Gave it one less star due to the inpatient cashier, that seems to have issues. Overall still a great experience!

jVLnOxcmX_4NfJMKedmBpg.text: Very mediocre. OJ and Hot Chocolate were good. Fresh fruit as well. Everything else we had was flavorless.

aiKcYrVbq4VzYp1tvargbg.text: Expensive ($23pp!), and not good.  Nothing flows or goes together, line is weird & laid out so you start near desserts...just plan weird and not good.    Example: they had fajita meats (chicken & steak, with some peppers and onions & spices), but no shells of any kind or flavor, no toppings/garnishes...  ...at the grill...they had a baked (bone-in) chicken, grilled porkchop or some weird white fish fried and covered in egg...?!  WTH?

n9m1Plll3h5QLvfuEcZXFw.text: This place is honest and True, big servings, great service. I had an icy strawberry shake and the Vegas stack pancakes, three huge fluffy cakes with lashings of syrup. My usual would be three but at this size I could only eat two!  Just inside the Golden Gate casino, lots of signs in the casino point the way. Highly recommended for fast, no fuss servings, good value at $20 for my partner and I. Including tea and coffee.

htL_ZMApmZJvgPVhdkexew.text: Went here August 1, 2014 for dinner. Should have save my $26, it was not worth it. Smelled fishy when you walked in. Save your money. Even prime rib was tough. Service was good, not there fault food is bad.

UW7Ruo1HPhY75syAFP8-vQ.text: First off, I know you can only do so much with a buffet.  After a while everything tastes the same.  My wife and I went to the breakfast buffet in November.  First off the moved the buffet to the second floor.  The line for the buffet is poorly planned.  There is a line to the cashier to pay, but no space to wait for the hostess to seat you.  So after you pay you are getting crammed by other people paying while you are waiting to be seated.  Just strange in my opinion.  The food there is your basic breakfast food.  Nothing great, just average.  Some of the food was not kept hot enough or replaced fast enough when they ran out.    Overall, probably better places to eat for the price and atmosphere.

D1Exbt7R-cCiWtIRZ_bV3w.text: I love this place for champagne brunch. I have gone to other large casinos for champagne brunch, where they are stingy on the mimosa part but not Golden Nugget. The drink waitresses refills and refills and leaves the container with a group of 5 drunken 20 somethings is beyond awesome.   Their food yes is average but they have a good make your own omelet station and salad bar. I loved the mashed potatoes. Pancakes were good. Place like I said I have been to the bigger more expensive buffets where most of the food tasted just like the Golden Nuggets. Biggest difference I believe is when it comes to the desserts.   So go here for Sunday Champagne brunch. Awesome.

_Vwlyt_7FRtaC7REZRn0dA.text: The food was delicious. I did not have one thing I didn't like. We went on Memorial Day for dinner. It was clean and the staff was so nice. The ice cream was the best thing. So creamy and delicious.

8YCvQlKot4om-qIVqgsvug.text: Buffet good selection, price 20.99, reasonable for Vegas. Dessert buffet: most were very bland, not a rich taste. Ice cream maybe the best part

33267MDOEAUfUoM9HYi_dw.text: It was great that we got Comped tickets for the Friday night Seafood special...but one word to describe it "Horrible" the hot crab legs were mushy and old looking, the seafood stew was mostly sauce with some type of mystery meat floating around, the beets, green beans, mashed potato,etc etc were all canned food type quality, the shrimp and mussel station was nothing more than cooking it it in a cup of butter and some spices.  Save your $dollars and buy a burger at the snack bar next to  the sports book.

44P61BdTHyySQ5NuBf1ksw.text: Who woulda thought you can get crab legs at a place like this??  For the price, this is a great buffet spot.

9HEwPpnCUuWFVDHs2ZOxvA.text: This buffet is a little expensive compared to Fremont  and main street and has a small selection of food for the price.     Most items I have tried were reasonably good but not a lot  to offer considering other buffets are much cheaper  and has comparable food for less with more options.   Overall the G/N has reasonably good food but price and  selection being weighed I would give them 3 stars, unless  you have 2 for 1 coupon then they are a good choice.

hosfM-C8rsYBrr0XPAG7bA.text: Was back at the GN buffet this past Saturday,  and i must say the crab legs were phenomenal.  How ever the lack of prime rib dropped the score down.  Wait staff was excellent.  Go there.  I will return. . .

uevjxYsX_WpVk_CXislXIg.text: Good cheap place to eat in Vegas. For two people including drinks for a full Buffet the price was less than $25... NOT BAD for Vegas. The food is tasty and like any other Buffet you have to search and find what food(s) suite your taste buds. I ate here twice during my 4 day stay in Vegas.

UMnPD2lKEv28LygHBBcBSA.text: You guys are trippin.   We really enjoyed our buffet last Saturday night, St. Patrick's Day.  At their carving station they had a huge corned beef,  the prime rib was rare and delicious, they also had ribs, and turkey which I didn't try, but looked really good too.  They had crab, both cocktail and hot.  In my opinion it was worth it just for the crab and prime rib.   Our server was very attentive too.  I told him how much I loved the Bourbon sauce, ice cream, and some kind of wonderful praline bar, he suggested the bread pudding and even brought it for me with more sauce to boot.

bLu0xXs3KNFqbzKjTeZ7zg.text: This is definitely the fanciest and most expensive buffet in Downtown.  However, the selection isn't very large.  The food seemed fresher and was of better quality than other buffets.  However, the selection was not very large and had some odd choices available.  I would go to the buffet at Main Street Station if given a choice.

9X44KEi_JTvtwYPWj0S_hw.text: This may be my fourth Buffet in Vegas, Second best, the bottom two way behind. The food is good, we went on prime rib night and didn't have to fight for it. Also a great desert bar, best "bread pudding" I ever had. Where they really excelled was a waiter named Darryl. I eat out a lot and this guy is something. When hes not filling drink orders he is busing tables, moving them for different size groups, He's beyond pleasant, every movement has a purpose. He's what will make me come back. Spent 10 years in a convention hotel, I recognize the talent.

o6Dqx75gfmh0fwC36BO_gQ.text: very disappointed. I have been going to this champagne brunch for years. the service was always good and champagne flowed freely. went today and not only was the price $5 more, no more free champagne. our server's english was not the best and it sounded like she said it was included but alcohol cost extra. it was $3 for a mimosa and $4.50 For a glass of champagne. the weekly paper listed it as champagne brunch for $19.99. we questioned them at the front and were told it changed 3 months ago. how would we know that? no offers of compromise. too bad because the food is very good. I just feel a little duped.

NpZaFH9rcMUcQTgF10J1wg.text: My family and I had the dinner buffet at the Golden Nugget. For $24.99, there wasn't much of a selection compared to other expensive buffets out there. Some of the foods were dry and taste like blah. The prime rib was all bloody (yuck). We've been to many different buffets and I think the cheap ones are way better than this place.

Jq4RNs9flDIqAlI79wYoAA.text: Totally gone down the tube. Way overpriced for food out of a box. Deserts are dry, old and inedible. Meat is like boot leather. The oysters stunk of dead fish. Plus just like the Paradise Buffet at Freemont, they were stuck to the shell. Very old.    Wait staff was as rude as they come. Wanted a 20% gratuity for my party of 8. This is a BUFFET dang it. WE get our OWN FOOD. Then they seated us 4 to a table across the room from each other. The buffet had 15 people in it. They did this out of spite. Stay away.

WQo75u24G3Qby6eDglzuLA.text: I really didn't want to try this place due to some of the reviews. We didn't have much luck in Vegas for seafood buffet. This place was very good and for the price of 20.99 on Tuesday Seafood Buffet. Now it didn't have much for seafood as I like. I enjoy crab legs and steamed shrimp. It didn't have crab legs. And the shrimp was cold. I did ask the cook at the pasta station if he could heat them up and boy did he go out of his way. He saute them in butter and garlic and added some other spices and they were amazing. The carving station was nice with moist roast beef and turkey. The sausages was good as well. There was 4 types sushi but not what I would eat, and the fried shrimp was good. The pasta station was unique and an abundant of deserts. I did not have any since I was so full. Decent place if your close by.

2AoTov8JA2nM33odq7rsJw.text: OMG, I love a salad bar. And this buffet has one! So there's that. Other than the salad bar, they have your standard buffet fare; prime rib, turkey, pizza, chicken, make-your-own pasta, a bit of seafood and quite a few small desserts.  All the stations were manned when I needed them, which is always nice, but the server put my gravy all over everything on the plate (including the pizza) instead of just on the turkey and/or mashed potatoes. Nothing stood out as being super good, but it was plentiful and, well, I always have the salad bar. And the shrimp. I love shrimp. The sushi (California roll-type) was decent, too. They never dallied in taking away dirty plates.

FMibLZ1CPb79EGRwWLX6Yw.text: I accidentally stumbled upon this buffet. We were in downtown Vegas doing some good old daytime drinking and wandering around when it hit us. We hadn't ate anything all day! Time to find some grub and fast.  We were wondering in and out of almost every casino till we somehow made it to the second floor of the Golden Nugget. We scoped out the lunch buffet, and for $11 we gave it a shot.   For a buffet, I thought it was pretty tasty. Granted, I do not eat meat, so I can't vouch for their meat dishes, but they had plenty of options for both vegetarians and carnivores. I read the previous reviews only after going here, and disagree with them. I don't know if I just came at the right time, but all dishes were freshly put out.   I filled up on their numerous salads. Artichoke/tomato mix, caprese, pasta salad, 4 bean salad, and potato salad. All were delicious. I also had some mac and cheese that was pretty tasty too. The GN buffet really hit the spot, I am so glad we discovered it,

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Nugget Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp cocktail CHEERS!

0Nb62qB7jEOP13dAifZhHA.text: $20 bucks for brunch buffet on a sunday morning. typical standard buffet in Las Vegas  highlights: omelet bar, good ice cream, perfectly cooked bacon.  service was kinda slow (even though the place wasn't packed), and the eggs were kind of soggy.  If you are desiring breakfast in downtown LV, there are lots of way cheaper options on Fremont St,  ie: $5.99 for steak and eggs, skip the Golden Nugget Buffet.

i_RV7oLt8ox4jJDB5u0cTQ.text: Actually, I thought this buffet was pretty darn good! Decent variety of choices - crab legs, fried shrimp, hush puppies, chinese food, and of course .. prime rib. I have to say, the prime rib here was excellent. Tender, tasty and the outer 'crust' had just the right saltiness to it. Mmmm.   Lots of choices from the salad bar section. Many buffets skimp on the fixings in buffet salad bars, but I like those that let me have a variety of raw veggies to pile on as well as shredded cheese and crunchies like sunflower seeds and/or croutons.   Desserts were pretty good. Fresh, moist cakes and a variety of ice cream flavors to choose from. I don't remember the price going in, which I take as a sign that it wasn't ridiculously priced. I want to say it was around $20. Not bad at all.  Bonus? Everyone working there was super nice. Always a plus.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Nugget Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

w1Re9YNJWwgnaTd1Ws1EaQ.text: The biggest problem with the Golden Nugget "The Buffet" is the hostess/seater.  We went for breakfast on a Monday morning, and the line was long.  After we finally got in after about a 30 minute wait (9:30 am), we knew why the wait was so long.  There was only one "seater".  Paying was quick, but with only one seater, one slow seater, we noticed many open, set tables stay open for at least 10 minutes before anyone was seated at them.  We experienced several other buffets where the staff busted their buts cleaning off tables and seating new parties.  The breakfast food at this buffet was decent, and it actually had the best selection of items at its salad bar.  One weird feature about this buffet is that there are yellow lights above most of the tables which makes it hard to differentiate colors on your plate.

8ad0Scg72-7HjVTokBQ_Mw.text: We stayed at the Golden Nugget for three days and had a chance to enjoy the buffet twice; both times for breakfast.    The service was exceptional but you can't really screw up serving coffee or juice (well, maybe you can, but this was definitely not the case here during our visit).  We found all of the breakfast items, as well as all of the items on the buffet, to be very high quality.  Hot foods were hot and cold foods were cold.  The freshly made to order omelettes were very good; the ingredients very fresh.    This made us very happy.  We would definitely go back.

_DlM6FSWeLi4oCQBF_S6og.text: Saturday night buffet.,$51.94 for two.  All I can say is horrible and over priced. Well I'll say more. Rude service. Food is dry, bland, nasty. Broccoli soup tasted fishy. Everything over cooked.  Go to McDonalds around the corner. No wonder it's basically empty.

fMdlc3VeKYfWF5eycGjbYQ.text: Just a quick chime in on my wife and I dining experience here at the Golden Nugget buffet...very good great food good service and lots to choose from.if your looking for a good buffet downtown I highly recommend going there.

zAJfUre1e1VcPe78zk-p-A.text: I have been in Golden Nugget  times already, always had good time, is a really nice buffet, excellent service, delicious food, really nice experience! I recommend to everybody!

LdGSuQm56aKUQDXfSK00pQ.text: We've been to a few buffet places and this place Not that great but the seafood was good. Deserts were subpar and the choices were ok. Prime rib roast was dry. Just not worth the high price of $29. Waitress was sweet and very attentive.

YqD_MzLcbM6Sfcj2BrHFkg.text: Ate there for brunch. They advertise brunch but all they had was an omelette station. Food was horrible from the Chinese to the pizza and everything in between. Would not recommend no Matter what they charged

kQ3T5FscF49OkzkN8_D_1A.text: This is the worst buffet in Las Vegas hands down. If you are looking for a place where the staff is right out of South Central Los Angeles who only cater to their kind you have found the right place. I have been to a lot of buffets in Las Vegas and the food here has probably the worst flavor ever. Don't be fooled by the photo you are looking at the best of what they have.

K1NCl1Hs-kXKVTUnyobBUg.text: Don't expect anything grand here.   The service is polite, but the food is average at best. It's best to stick to the hard-to-botch items like omelettes and carved meats.   The $25 for brunch is only worth it if you plan to really load up a few plates, otherwise stick to a sit down place or a buffet on the Strip.

vJ5vADezlT1lJfQiQIpfyg.text: They food is good. Needs a little bit more spices. The servers are at your beckon call they do a outstanding job getting you whatever you need. They have everything at the buffet from meats to salads to Suites if you're a vegetarian they can take care of that need as well.

Photo of Golden Nugget Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. How do you like your eggs
Photo of Golden Nugget Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Let your stomach be your guide

nPCH94KXb_tk0GusfKJIeQ.text: Found a piece of metal in my food. Had a party of 8 and no one wanted to finish there food after that and was only reimbursed one plate. We were just getting started to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Nugget Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Found a piece of metal in my food. Had a party of 8 and no one wanted to eat there food anymore. I  was only reimbursed one plate.

UwXqKx1Qe9guyoa0-iFa-g.text: As far as Vegas buffets go, the Golden Nugget isn't going to blow your socks off. It's not bad, it's just not great. My most recent visit was Memorial Day weekend so prices for buffets were incredibly inflated ($50+ per person) so when we walked by and saw the GN was only $21.99 we went for it. We wanted to get one vegas buffet visit in during our trip.   The best options were the pastas- mac and cheese, ravioli, bow tie pasta. Lots of creamy sauces!Some of the Asian offerings were pretty good too especially the General Tao's chicken. Spicy, sweet and cooked nicely so it was crispy on the outside and moist on the inside.   I have a massive sweet tooth so the dessert section was heaven! I highly recommend the pineapple upside down cake and the Black Forest cake. Did not like the coconut cream pie or the apple cobbler.   If you're looking for an affordable buffet with some decent food, this is your place. If you're looking for a foodie experience, go somewhere else.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Nugget Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Nugget Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IGt2w9VWgk5Pwy1LC_hdvw.text: In my opinion paying that much for the things they have for you at the Golden Nugget Buffet to eat is just sad and cheap. It was $44. Per person and the y had everything from lox to fried spam. Out just wasn't very good to me.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Nugget Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

m7bKx1cvmtDYsCMPjtrn7A.text: Not the biggest, or fanciest of buffets, but I gotta give the Golden Nugget Buffet an A-Okay for the cleanliness of the buffet. Don't you tired when there are a lot of people who riffle through the food at a buffet? And what is left is a big nasty mess! Well, you don't have to worry about that when you come to the Golden Nugget Buffet! I must say it's rather clean, and very well presented. I've eaten there mostly for breakfast & dinner in the past, and have always had a pretty pleasant experience. I was just here the other day for breakfast.........the breakfast buffet is not really large with a lot of selection, but what they do have is probably sufficient for you to fill your tummy. I do like that they have a carving station, and a chef that will make you fresh eggs or a fresh omelet. Besides all the nasty breakfast meats - :Link Sausage, Bacon, Portuguese Sausage, Chicken Fried Steak, Spam, etc., they do offer a healthy fare too like oatmeal, cereal, or fresh fruit. As for me, da local boy in me gotta have his Spam! Yes, if Spam was healthy.........I swear on my deathbed that I'd eat it everyday! That's how much I love Spam!!! For you folks (NFH) = Not From Hawaii..........Hawaii people eat the most Spam per any capita! Spam is da Hawaiian Steak Yo!!!! See this link yourself - thehawaiiplan.com/why-do... And don't get me wrong, I didn't only eat Spam here.........I also had a fresh egg omelet with everything in it! And I must say the omelet was deeeeeeeeeeeelicious!!!! To add some healthy junk in, I ate some grapefruit, then to ruin by healthy eating, I proceeded to eat a slice of cheesecake & bread pudding! LoL! Hey man, it's all about moderation right? LoL! Service here is pretty good, as the waiter or waitress is pretty attentive. They also leave you a big pot of coffee (if you're a coffee drinker), that way you won't have to keep bothering the waiter or waitress for a refill. How's that for efficiency? Well, if you're ever in the downtown area, check out the Golden Nugget Breakfast Buffet.......pretty inexpensive too at just $12.99 per person.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Nugget Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grapefruit, Cheesecake, &amp; Bread Pudding.
Photo of Golden Nugget Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Da local boy gotta have his Spam! Omelet with everything in it, &amp; Breakfast potatoes.

oGmoQvBiUB2kWOEm2pSWDg.text: I decided to try something different in Downtown, so the Golden Nugget Buffet, here I come!  I read the reviews and most of them were negative and targeted for dinner.  The positive reviews were for the breakfast.  Let me check this out.  The selection was big.  Anywhere from the simple cereal and yogurt to salmon. Eggs Benedict and steak.  The steak was medium to medium rare and tender.  It was also flavorful. I also tried the freshly carved ham.  I was expecting it to be a little salty and dry, but I was pleasantly surprised that it was juicy and not salty.  It was really good.  I don't know if I would visit for dinner, but i'll definitely be back for breakfast.

QRfnjdmJFVMRQhKpl2rS8w.text: It has its on floor button on the elevator. (Awesome af.) Walk in greeted by 2 very nice ladies with a smile. Paid 25$ at 9pm. Far away from the food.  Ok thats cool, Got a booth it was very soft and had so many different colors of vertical lines, mesmerizing. The guy who cut the meat looked very mad as he slices my un eat able piece of roast beef he gave me. The refill guy was on point.  I peed two times he just kept filling my drink. Most the food was ok, they had collard greens with bacon.  The sign does not say bacon so if i was Muslim i would be pissed.  Great desserts though check it out  P.s. I don't care about grammer  Sorry 12 grade english teacher.

MZj0PzeoRE4ysfnCtcA2AA.text: Brought my party of 24 here. The food was ok. They had a lot of stations, but the quality wasn't anything spectacular. The owner was nice and worked with our tables. As a wedding party, I wish they would have had one long table instead of two tables on top of each other. We had a few people that didn't show up but couldn't get our money back for whatever reason. Very expensive for the quality.  Will try a different place next time.

uCcUaLDqVhkIt2FxHs9vrA.text: First thing was that the price was ridiculous (23.99 -Dinner Price); which the buffet had less chooses then at a Golden Coral. Secondly, the food was not enjoyable in the least. I seriously recommend spending your money anywhere else.

BoEkkgg22m5D8rYTVCPOXQ.text: Don't bother coming for Seafood Friday Night Dinner. Pretty disappointing. I have been to lots of buffets and this is not one I would recommend. The crab was dry, the shrimp are small. The fried calamari and clams were over done. This used to be a great one to come to...but not anymore

0fWB1f-2BK9fMgYTAbP9zQ.text: Took the family to this buffet while we were in Vegas this last week. We went on a Wednesday, which was steak night, and the advertised price was 15.95. Word to the wise, this is when you join their rewards program, so make sure to do that first. Our overall bill for a family of 6 was $102, which was equivalent to what we paid for fast food burgers on the strip.  The variety of food was good, although I would have liked to see a little more variety of items. There were some things that looked like they had been there a while, which was not a sight to see.  The steak I had was good, so that helped, and I really enjoyed the baked potatoes. My kids and husband tried a variety of items and the steak and shrimp was their favorite. The staff was great and the waiter we had was fantastic. The line to get in was quite painful and, when I left, it looked like we had "beat the crowd." I would say that this is a good buffet for someone looking for a deal and some good food. My kids and husband enjoyed it and it did not completely take all my money, so give it a try.

E3BdX69QlAwP5xq9e4dQOg.text: For an inexpensive buffet this was terrific. Loved the food. Extra tasty was the fried chicken.  Desserts were very good as well.  I like the older casinos. Easier to park and navigate around.

BHTGXVXngrLK4XVUOh583g.text: Maybe I went in with too high of hopes?  Maybe I was expecting them to be able to compete with the big buffets on the strip?  Maybe I'm right and I really have experienced better?  It didn't start well when we arrived and found no line.  We approached the counter and the hostess told us to go to the other side of the counter.   No problem.  Then THAT hostess told us to go to other side.   So neither wanted to help us?  That wasn't a great introduction.    We were seating pretty quickly after we paid for our lunch.  From this point on, the service was fantastic. The servers look like they've been since the Golden Nugget opened - but that's a good thing!  They know what service should look and feel like.  Personalized, polite, quick, and always done with a smile.  Good job to that team!  Unfortunately, the food was fairly basic, and in a few cases, less than.  I had some Turkey, but had to reach over the counter to add the gravy I wanted.  Odd setup.  They had sandwiches, which I guess is OK, but not what I want from a buffet.  I'll go to the pool bar for that.  The chicken was dry, the soup was salty - all in all, it was just basic.  They are a smaller buffet so don't expect a ton of choices compared to the Strip buffet's, but that wouldn't have mattered had the food been amazing.    In the end, it served it's purpose, which was filled us up for the afternoon so we could gamble more.  Will I be back - hard to tell on that one, but I would probably want a 1/2 off coupon.

YT5JMcOVIM0KbwjfIyuNSA.text: The Sunday brunch was disappointing.  Nothing seemed fresh - omelet being an exception. Cinnamon rolls were hard.  Ended up eating cereal.  On the flip side the service was great and had a nice view of the pool.  Way too many better choices than this buffet, unfortunately.

DzXvWhzLxjiB0iQHHz6qtw.text: I love buffets.. and for Las Vegas I guess you sorta want the best of the best in buffets.  We paid $17 per person for this place and it was ok at best.  The food seemed like it was out for quite a while and they werent exactly speedy on replacing it with fresh food.  I guess the best buffets out there arent the ones at the big casinos, but the small places.  Heck even for GOlden Nugget, I was hoping even with it not being that big.  Ehh.. Oh well.   Will I go back?  Sure...  but not for dinner.

QM0m_l6-vOTnpu9e-iHZ6g.text: I really think I'm spoiled when it comes to buffet's.  The Bellagio knocks my socks off, so the Golden Nugget just makes them slouch.  Honestly, if you go to the Bellagio on the weekend for brunch and get the bottomless mimosas...the Golden Nugget is just the same price.  I can say though that they have a made to order sauteed shrimp bar that we just couldn't get enough of.  We kept going back to try the different combinations of flavors (garlic, spicy, etc).  It's a push for me....I think if I stayed in old Las Vegas I would hit up the Golden Nugget Buffet but if we stayed at the HR as we always do, I probably won't make the trek.

s3e5oszUSWFt3Oh_vUrSdw.text: Down home American cooking , soul food , thanksgiving dinner , sandwiches and a great view of the pool while pigging out on pork ribs with sweet potatoes . Heck ya

kAhcUTlpjeMXxS4YZ03Vjw.text: Very expensive and the food isn't very good.Small selection as well.For the price,your better off going to one of other restaurants in the Golden Nugget,and there are some good ones.

LYSHBG9uqn4YRN4zFb4law.text: This place deserves more credit than it's getting on Yelp.  The food here was perfectly good and a great deal cheaper than many of the other buffets in Vegas - especially if you have coupons, which we did.  It was a nice selection of food for both breakfast and lunch (Though breakfast is over at 10:30 :( at least the omelet station is open all day).  The staff was pretty attentive and very friendly.

UjiM-ujtQBogQ83Dth0LRw.text: So I wanted to wait a few weeks to calm down before I wrote this. I took my wife and daughter to the Golden Nugget, being a new resident to Las Vegas we had heard a lot of good things about the Gold Nugget and wanted to experience it for ourselves. I am a food and beverage manager by trade so typically I am more patient but still critical of food.  The Golden Nugget Buffet is the worst buffet I have ever encountered.  In 20 years of food and beverage I have never seen specials listed as "Chef Special with coagulated sauces and chunks of mystery meat. The seafood salad was in chunks of imitation crab that was not even broken up and was hard as a rock with a pungent seafood odder coming from it.  I went to the pasta station hoping to find some fresh items and the mushrooms on the station were black and the sauce wasn't an Alfredo sauce it was also some coagulated cream sauce that the cook after preparation scooped piles of parmesan cheese on top of.  For $18.99 not only did I leave with a literal bad taste in my mouth but the service was horrific as well. The server came to refill my daughters coke with watered down coke that had no carbonation in it at all, he showed up three times to the table and didn't even speak once to us. When leaving I was handing my parking ticket to the hostess in the front who was yawning and when I approached her she put her arm up and continued to yawn and pointed toward the cashier who let me know I could validate downstairs..... This seems to be the Fools Gold of Las Vegas in my opinion!

isHoF8QCESoUKQLG3V1O_Q.text: Pretty decent.  Not the most extravagant buffet in Downtown Las Vegas.  Breakfast is typically best meal for buffets.  Dinner was okay.

OLudvLrIBwbrfuMdxWga8w.text: Service was good. Selections were average, maybe more selection on seafood. Waiter was attentive. The facility can use some renovation.

E_y-_dtZ0gVdkK9w09kfbA.text: There are plenty of better buffets elsewhere. Don't let the popularity and upscale feel of the hotel/casino trick you into thinking the buffet will also be good.

058Ub818iWNeqopr2BYRpg.text: This is the worst place to eat. All of the food was nasty. Never, ever, ever, again!!!

H9ncOEPRVv9GucqrZSaoFQ.text: We had a 2 for 1 coupon so that made up for some of the negatives.  This is standard mid range buffet fare.  It all was presented nicely and looked good, but the official tasters must have had the day off.  Just about everything tasted generic.  The only standout was the chef making omelets and eggs.  He did a very good job of getting the eggs just the way I wanted them.

mv3LmcJl8MSESJg2iLEQWw.text: I feel like two stars is a bit generous but one star may be a bit harsh.. prob more like 1 1/2 stars.   In short, just dont do it!!!  First time visiting Freemont Street. Our friends were starving when we arrived so finding food was on the top of the priority list. We settled with The Golden Nugget so we didn't force anyone into a major case of hypoglycemia.   Considering we paid 20 bucks, on a weeknight, I was expecting something somewhat decent.... aaaand I was wrong. Everything had this wired gray hue to it. Mixed greens and spinach on the salad bar was wilted with small pieces of rotten lettuce intertwined. The romaine and iceberg was the only thing that looked edible. The beets were a strange hue of gray(ish)-red.  I wish I had taken a picture. I didn't even dare touch them. My fiance had a small portion of fried rice and chow mein on his plate and I couldn't believe he would even dish that stuff on his pale. Both looked like they had been sitting under a heat lamp for about 5 hours. SO dry and greasy looking. *gag* Steak offered was too tough to even chew through. My friend and I LITERALLY had to spit it out into our napkins because there was no chewing through that stuff. Simply horrible. Mashed potatoes tasted old and stale. Desserts looked like something you would find at your grandmother nursing home (then again, so did everything else). Apple pie had a filing that looked like it had come straight from a can...only with no apples in it. Just this wierd apple-jelly-goo. Its hard to mess up sugar, guys! They somehow managed.   The only thing on the buffet that tasted even remotely decent was the carved turkey and scalloped potatoes. Oh, and the ice cream from the ice cream counter was edible.   Honestly, Ive had better meals at HomeTown Buffet and Golden Corral and paid about half as much.   Avoid, avoid, avoid.

gCsbYxrt78GZMTRacQvKgg.text: First off I am not a fan of Buffets in Las Vegas. We went to the Seafood Buffet on saturday night and it was amazing. Everything that I ate was great and I did not only eat seafood. This is the best buffet I have had in a long time. I will say I have not been to the M or similar places that are $35 per person but for $22 each the Golden Nugget is definately worth it.

Il3QAB4GPkaA3Y0xkckvjQ.text: Had a decent dinner for a decent price (Thursday was $18.99). Buffet lines were dog-eat-dog, people can be really rude, but the staff was professional and friendly and the food was plentiful and good. I'd do it again.

QMBFOlUT9y_Rcsh-t9cNAQ.text: not gonna' lie, the customer service here is hit or miss. a lot of the older women servers seem to have attitudes, although i'm not sure why. the food is decent, and various, but again, decent. you kinda' get what you pay for though at $20-25.

rofceWDrVnP9g5H3l6m5sw.text: The Golden Nugget's buffet was pretty good. We payed 17 dollars a person which is fairly cheap compared to some buffets in Vegas. By far we ate the shrimp and crab legs the most. The selection was good: seafood, asian, Italian, American, plenty of desserts. If your in the area this is a perfectly fine buffet to go to but no need to drive out of your way to come here.

uGX0XHEq7p22KsADszp3pw.text: Small and cozy. Nice and friendly waitress. To small selection, roast beef was over cooked and dry, same goes for the turkey.

NgpvCVjRjiJ0tCIx7L1nrA.text: One of the worst buffets I've ever at.  When the best you can find at the salad bar is lettuce, cheese and tomato--it's pathetic.  The ribs, seafood, Chinese, Italian--horrible.  How do you screw up a simple calzone????  Worse part--$24!!!!

8QDLSGqXYfcrt7cMZF47lA.text: This wasn't the worst buffet I've been too but it's got a spot near the top. We took the tour bus trip and GN is one of the stops. Needing lunch, we thought it best to eat at the hotel since he bus comes around every 45 minutes or so. We found the buffet, not a line, not too terribly busy. I paid with my credit card and was seated. I'll get back to the credit card later. The food was...ok. It was food. We were thankful to not starve but it was a step above cafeteria food (the kind you were dished up as a kid). But it filled us up, service was great. Later that day I checked my statement and $2 was added to my total. So I'm thinking someone wrote in a $2 tip on the tip line. Because I know the price of the buffet, I know what I authorized and I was charged $2 more. I didn't call,  I didn't make a big deal out of it. I just thought it was lame. Want more tips? Work harder. Much better food in LV for the price, never again.

cpMY_r9cWsZ18eQTvXEPiA.text: Food is average, good if you are hungover and need a heavy meal. Mimosas are cheap and heavy with champagne. Which is good!!! Lol

UxxKLtFWczp-e55Qp6fttg.text: This is my first time here and the selection is great if you are a meat person like myself. They have a carving station with a wide variety of meat, as well as pulled pork, chicken, salmon, shrimp and more...they have a sandwich area as well as desserts  area. Would have giving it 5 stores if the staff was more attentive....price for two was $54.10 with tax...not too pricey...I will definitely return....on a side note we were sat by the windows, great view  of the pool and Shark tan.. impressive....

p0EyiL_1puekeFMdEGs3xA.text: Got a coupon for two breakfast buffets, had the breakfast two days in a row. Eggs were good, other stuff ok but here's the real kicker for me...both days tater-tots were the only potato option at breakfast. Classy.    Mix in some shreds or home fries and I'll bust out another star on you @GoldenNuggetLV

3e1fPBVW05UgHPqrNy6KSg.text: AWFUL! Not worth the expensive price. Food was cold and very poor quality. Left me feeling uneasy.

LdxtA8R5NeSege9bU4covg.text: Your typical buffet. BUT! I do have to say that this is one of the best ones with a great selection of salads!! Macaroni  salad wasn't sour! There was caprese salad too! Artichoke salad. And even a shrimp pasta salad that was on point! They also have pre-put-together sandwiches and sushi. They also have an egg omelette station. Their dessert selection could have included jello and something more appealing than pies and cakes...Overall, better than Paradise's buffet!!

pTK3ABcW-dVLP5uueQYx9w.text: After walking around the block on a Saturday night trying to find a restaurant that was not packed and had vegetarian options we resorted to just going to a buffet, (they are bound to have something vegetarian friendly, right?). I have never been to a vegas buffet, so I was super excited!  The waitress let us take a tour of the buffet first to see if anything appealed to us and then we went back to the cash, paid, and got our seats.  The buffet was nice, honestly, they had a lot of great options for meat an seafood lovers. Unfortunately not a whole lot for vegetarians, but we made it work. I mostly filled up on the salad bar an cheese pizza. My hubby got a delicious cream pasta made that was really good as well as an omelet.   The desert bar was nice, and had a great selection of sweets.  The one thing that threw me off, was the woman working the salad station. She kept taking her dirty rag and pushing all the dropped food back in the bins. Not appealing, and for sure, not very sanitary.  Two plates in and I was content, and the hubby was stuffed. Worth the price? For us, it was not, but the experience was nice.

awROQRVwDNeppjVeoztHgg.text: Don't do it.. eat somewhere else. This place will make you sick!  Crap food everywhere!

Ct_1Xw_vU0uG7T5Iica0QQ.text: I don't like giving things one star, but the buffet at the Nugget earned it. I would put this Buffet into the category of: Not only would I not eat there again, I would aggressively try to change my friends mind if there was a group trying eating there.  We ate there for Sunday brunch (yesterday) right around 10:00am. It's $18 for champagne brunch even if you don't want champagne. Everything was cold except the omelette/egg stuffs the guy cooked right in front of you. No hyperbole on that. Eggs, bacon, pizza, veggies, fried shrimp, rice, eggs benedict...it was ALL cold. We started trying things we didn't even really want just to see if it was cold. It was.  Fine, ok. You're hungover and you're just going to drink $18 worth of bubbles. Wrong. The service is sloooooow. You'll be lucky to have three or four flutes of champagne in an hour. They don't exactly take the time to fill the glass up to the top either.  If you get suckered into eating here by your friends, stick with the guy making the omelettes and eggs. That'll be hot. And you can toast the bread yourself, so you know that will be good. The omelette guy will, however, cook the ever living bejesus out of your omelette so that it's dry.

JXuWWn_T5kBL-J1ucfoOPA.text: The best bread pudding in the world. Beautiful poolside views, quick lines. This place is really underrated and probably the best value as far as buffets go in all of Vegas. Funny complaint - the chairs have arm rests which make getting in and out of your seat difficult as there is no room to scoot your chair all the way out. Comfortable but not functional in a tightly squeezed space.

CJvUZQD6Vy-R3HP838JrRA.text: This place is overpriced and the food is disgusting. The server I got was great. The hostess was extremely rude. She started arguing to the cashier in front of me. They were both speaking in Spanish and when I asked what was the problem also in Spanish. They just looked stunned and didn't answer my question. I will never set food there again and neither should you.

sJtIyubgQXoyRZAKcrSZoA.text: I love the Golden Nugget but I do not love dried out, bland, uninspired food. Unless something changes magically, I won't be back.

_SXLLatNMhoQi4XUq7bN1w.text: For right around $25, I expected much more.  The eggs Benedict was poor at best.  The whole buffet was very disappointing.

pJdl-7fiQzV7Z5ladNNceQ.text: Stayed at this hotel many times but never made it to the buffet. This time we drove in from another hotel to try the weekday breakfast. We got there right at the changing of the bfast/lunch menu. We paid a dollar more, I think it was $13.99. It's small, just enough.. nothing to write home about. But for the price we paid it was ok. The servers were slow with the re-fills and were never around and the guys behind the food counter were grumpy. But hey, what do you expect. I don't think, I would come for a weekend price though.

GX8qAdfsqssGDgF6Yg-PMw.text: I don't know why there's a lot of bad reviews but with those aside, the Gold Nugget buffet was decent.  We went on Thanksgiving and it took about thirty minutes before we got in to be seated.  The food stations were all busy especially the pasta line where you could customize the pasta to your liking by choosing the pasta, sauce, and the type of meat.  I was actually waiting to go further for the other food since people were waiting when really it was just the pasta line.  The rest of the food I tried like the sushi were good in my opinion.  There was a whole section for dessert and their ice cream was pretty good.  It wasn't self-serve but that was fine.  Our waitress was nice and friendly as well.  I thought this was a good buffet.

IAhg51QGUDPXyB1DOiXoyQ.text: Had to stop at this landmark on our way through Vegas. Good buffet selection with quick table service. Food was okay for a buffet.
