CMF6Fcg5B8sqHwV__j9sSA.text: This buffet sucks I paid $48 or $58! I should've gone to one of the station casinos it's way cheaper also the food here was not even that good for $50 I could've paid $50 and gone to the damn Caesars Palace which is way prettier inside. The lady that worked in the front name Dianne I was rude to us to and some of the food was cold. I never got asked for a refill on my drink either. Next time I will go downstairs to the chart house or to another buffet like I said.

qBKfMPdSYsqzuj4vFn6v-A.text: So my buddy and I hit the buffet based on a great memory I had a couple of years ago. Unfortunately my memories deceived me. Let me explain why...  We went out there Sunday night - the seafood buffet is ONLY Friday and Saturday. Every other night they basically only have shrimp. While they were decent certainly nothing to write home about. For some reason they had "warm plates" right next to cold shrimp - dumb.   As far as the rest of the food, pretty poor. The sushi was very limited and while it was relatively fresh (watched the chef making it), it was very bland. The meatballs and pasta were awful, as was the Chinese food.   The only thing of note in my mind was the desserts. They were plentiful and in a size such that you could have a few tasters without having to pick a single one.   As far as the staff, generally career waitresses who seem to care less. Was drinking a soda and they kept refilling it with warm soda and never added ice.   Maybe the seafood buffet is still good, but I would t hit this buffet again unless you enjoy desserts at a slightly lower cost than the strip buffets.

a6ooCr5kOB0xRQxHqH9zSg.text: Reading the reviews, I was a bit wary of this buffet, but it actually ended up being not that bad. Average, but good.  We visited at Noontime on Saturday. To note, they gave us the option to buffet with or without champagne. So there is not a forced purchase as others have mentioned.  All the food was warm, the service was steady, and our refills came often.  The one downside I could find this visit was that the Asian food section was bland.  However the omelette station was great, and there was also a great selection of desserts.  Overall don't come expecting this to be the Bellagio buffet or something high-class or fancy. Just remember where you're visiting.

r8nSn-NnelLYB-Ne6PFKuQ.text: definitely one of the more overpriced buffets in the area for  what you get, which isn't really a lot I was not pleased at all by the quality of any of the food there was no flavor there was no Chinese nothing was scrumptious everything was just really below average.

td-nDkoKPnRoKmJ1CLAEtg.text: Worst buffet ever for anyone with any kind of allergies.  I realize I am in the minority here, and my kids and husband did eat a good amount of food.  But it wasn't great.    They have NOTHING that is gluten free for dessert.  Almost everything has dairy in it.  Cute little pastries, cupcakes, pies, etc.  I just couldn't eat any of them.    I would not eat here again.  It's robbery for the food you get.

Am1vvx0iCoEV-K9J2Vf9Bg.text: For Christmas Dinner, I felt a buffet would be in order.  Something to usher in a great new year. Something epic. Something Santa would like.  I was walking around on Fremont Street and decided to turn in here.       After seeing the world's largest golden nugget on display, I caught sight of the Buffet sign. I meandered the maze of slot machines and card tables and eventually climbed the stairs to get to the buffet. Twenty(ish) dollars got me in and seated at a table where the two nicest ladies helped me out with beverages and taking away my plates.      My first round was certainly meaty. Pig, Cow, Fish, Crustacean, Fowl....no species of God's creation was safe from my appetite. "Sure I'll try that." "Can I get a slab of each please?"  "Oooh. Let's get some of those!" I'll admit. My eyes were far larger than my stomach with this trip. Everything looked way tasty and smelled wondrous. I was also kinda sorta guilty about how many species of animal were about to be sacrificed to me.     After plate number one I was considering throwing in the towel. Then one of the nicest ladies comfortingly said to me; "Take your time. Digest. You can stay all night if you want!" Thank you nicest lady. I really wish I remembered your name.  I broke out my game-boy and began playing video games for a lil bit to digest and clear out some space. Thankfully, I carry that thing for just such occasions.     After ten or so minutes, I made a stab at food sortie number two. I wanted to make my Mom happy, so I got a plate of salad. Crisp green veggies and red tomatoes. Even more numbers on the species list I suppose. All was refreshing and crisp and as good as these things can be.     After the veggie plate, I decided to make a run on the dessert station.  I made sure to grab a full sized plate for this trip. Pies. Cakes. Cannolis. Moussey things and creme brulee things. I tend to overdo it on the dessert round. Of course, by this point, I was super stuffed and while unable to completely finish the things, I was able to manage a sampling of everything.        The buffet is great.  It's very pretty. It's very tasty. I'm sure Santa would have been happy. Or Jesus. It's his birthday...right? Happy Birthday Jesus!      I'll be back if I'm wandering Fremont again. Thanks Golden Nugget!

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Nugget Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I think there are probably 10-12 species of animal on this place.

8SX9V7495ejZhMBN_WdbIA.text: Find somewhere else to eat.  The service was good but the meal choices weren't.  What choices they did have weren't good.  We should have spent the money on the Uber or Lyft and gone to The Strip for a better buffet.

nAOF_VfY6U9VnnOYrCP8xg.text: Not horrible, but NOT worth the price.  Most Vegas buffets are overpriced, heck, most FOOD anywhere in Vegas is overpriced. But this was $25 for basically glorified cafeteria food. Maybe if if they charged about half that you wouldn't feel so ripped off.  Then, at the bottom of the bill, they have the nerve to have a "suggested gratuity" of a full 15-20% of the bill, and show you how much that would be. Even though you waited in line, then served yourself. So that's for the guy that got you drinks. I know everybody wants to make a living. I just thought that was a little cheezy. Why don't they just pay the drink servers a little more. They certainly make enough money there.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Nugget Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

m4nzbQCnvHCx7eN7FCgcjw.text: This buffet is amazing, they have such a wide variety of foods. Also the hotel it's self is newly remodeled and makes everything feel super fancy. The hotel is in a slightly bad part of town but the hotel and buffet makes up for it.

E6Vv99cfPsJDjdGygQRJCA.text: Looks great but taste bland.  Drinks are 5 bucks which were worth it.  Food over all was a negative. Don't waste your money.

mbU7Z-4DIE5_l02AZDRDKw.text: This buffet made me decide that I no longer like buffets. Thanks, Golden Nugget!  EVERYTHING was dry... from the overcooked roast beef, to the CRUSTY Denver omelet, to the nasty desserts.  But, hey, their ice tea was good.  Service was terrible. We had plates of inedible food pilling up at the end of out table and it took way longer than expected to be taken away. I shouldn't have tipped the waitstaff but left a couple of bucks anyway so that they know we left and now they REALLY DO have to clear the #$%^ table.  Normally, I would give a buffet like this 1-star but there HAS to be a special place in Yelp Hell for Circus Circus's buffet.

k237cRfXSNmwLapSPxkDkg.text: Very good service here. Waitress refilled my drink the second it was empty. Very attentive with replacing new plates on the table as well.  I came on a Friday night. Some nice fish choices. Clam Chowder was not the best tasting. Pretty boring salad bar. Mediocre sushi. For $32 a person the best part would have been the crab legs, but i don't eat them so I'm a buffets best friend. Didn't try any of the desert options. Had fruit instead. Hey, you can't go wrong with that!   I dug the old school, never-been-remodeled vibe. It brings back old Vegas if you like that sort of thing, and I do. The place was not very busy which was a huge plus on a Friday night. No need to push your way through or wait in long lines! I should mention there was one waitress that was extremely loud. Simmer down. Just got paid. It's Friday night and i want to relaaax and eat in peace!

fT3Czap5_rNj4DRl5JMvdA.text: The breakfast food here sucks, most employees are friendly. We had a 2 for 1 coupon because we stayed at the Golden Nugget. I would not eat here again even if at half price. The scrambled eggs look to be congealed, the bacon was one big lump of grease. The guy working the omelet station was great, the best thing about this place. Coffee was much better than expected. Starbucks is a better option.

AUvfPzkTNZl8UEEK9-2SaA.text: Tried the breakfast buffet this morning.  In a nutshell, it was just okay.  The staff were courteous and attentive, but the food missed the mark of getting 4-stars.  The chicken fried steak patty has seen better days.  It was dry and a but stale probably from sitting there for a good while.  There were more items I tried that missed the wow factor and fell into the typical buffet food fair.    Will I be back? Probably not.  I think I'd rather pay for a good off the menu meal rather than an average 'all you can eat' buffet.

h5Zhxkbhz32C0atKHfRnLQ.text: During lunch this buffet has a lot of delicious choices from meats, side dishes, and desserts. The staff are really kind and outgoing, especially the lady who was our server. Overall, it was a great experience.

uJiQYTuQRBdqzTVmjflFDw.text: had a great experience I made reservation for my mom and dads 40th anniversary! Sharon@goldennugget.com she is the general manger of the buffet was very helpful with everything from the start of the reservation to the service! the food was wonderful! I would recommend this buffet! she told me she will take reservations of large party anytime! had called around to several buffet because my party was for 52 people! great great!

3-OYpwUWi-YWpqWJuxEmDA.text: Buffet? I don't think so. You would be better off anywhere else. And I mean anywhere.

VRZJMI0f3iSWJzfyUVRT6A.text: We ate here as a large group multiple times On our recent trip. Very clean, great selection and pretty good value. Would be 5 stars. Unfortunately the woman who Works the front desk, Loretta is rude to the point that I almost want to avoid this location all Together. Loretta for no reason speaks down to people. Simple issue of needing a table For 17. Instead of being friendly and explaining the whole party needs to be present she rudely states "well you have to wait", and snaps at us. I can't really explain it in words. She was just horrible.  We came back as a party of 2 the day we were leaving our honeymoon. We chose to Pay with a prepaid gift card (which we had used there before) right on the receipt after paying it Showed we still had over $100 On it. When she went to apply The tip her system Wouldn't allow Her. She sat there accusing me of not having money on my card and bringing a bunch of People over to add the tip. She held up the line making me Pull the card out again and be so rude and belittling to me again. My husband just went and got cash after the meal to tip the server.  Loretta needs to take a customer Service refresher coarse. I don't understand why she repeatedly was so rude to Us. By the way no one in my party was ever drunk. As we were there at the hotel for My wedding. When people put forth that much effort to get together, take time off Work, spend savings etc. they should receive proper service.   We went to the buffet 2 separate times And had wonderful service.

Z7XvVvSAw6qTJ3TSfHHnfA.text: I was disappointed in this Buffet! The service was good but the food was just "OK" or terrible. We were there on a Saturday night around 6pm and there was not wait, so that was nice. The main entree's were OK, the cheese and meat section was really nice however, some of that meat looked like it had been sitting out way too long to eat. Needed to be changed out. The desserts were TERRIBLE! Between the 6 of us in our party we tried MANY of the desserts and they were all old and terrible tasting except for the scooped ice creams and sorbets. Cakes, pastries, pies, pudding were not good. Next time we are in Vegas we will go to a different buffet.   For the price it was not worth it.

mvjjuOh9_LXfThrDVOgIXQ.text: My wife Fran and I went here on Christmas Day. A large sign out front listed the items being served for the day. A price under $20.00 was printed on this sign for breakfast. But no price was listed for lunch or dinner. You guessed it, we payed over  $20.00 for our meals.   The food was fine however. My wife enjoyed her prime rib. Even though when she asked the person carving for an end cut, she didn't receive one.  We asked to be seated with a view of the hotel pool and the shark tank. Too bad the pool was drained for winter time repairs. The sun was position perfectly so that the shark tank and other aquatic life were only shadows or glares from the sunlight.  I ate a little of everything.  Prime rib, cod, pork loin, and Turkey, all from the carving station. There was shrimp displayed, but I don't care for shrimp. But still,  nice to have more than one selection.   Vegetables on my plate included mashed pitatoes, asparagus, green beans with bacon.  That's right I ate asparagus without being told.   Cold cuts were cut up and presented very nicely.  Almost made me not want to ruin what was on display. Yeah I don't think so.  Turned out to be a descent outing. Here's to everyone having joyous holidays  My thanks to you for reading my reviews here on Yelp.

kgPy4wp9HYUZzKMJUFaKHQ.text: Saw a man sloppily remove his teeth and stow them in his pocket before sitting down to eat.  It was absolutely disgusting. Otherwise, the buffet was terrific. The selection was great, food was delicious, and drinks were refilled with excellent service.  I'd recommend going, but definitely try not to look around at anyone else while eating. You will be disappointed.

q23ulc3zNBjtjyYsIqsP6w.text: Very nice server, however the food left much to be desired. Wilted lettuce, long lines for mediocre dishes. Our kids talked us into this as it was our first night in town. I wouldn't go back. One caveat: the made-to-order omelette was excellent.

bx9xI_NYpyqbsagduHMZqw.text: This is a good buffet in downtown Las Vegas, if you take it for what it is then I don't think you will be disappointed. If you come on here expecting the buffet at the Aria or something like that then I guess you might be disappointed. Some of these reviews on here crack me up, people expect some outlandish stuff from a downtown buffet, but from my experience this place is certainly better than your average Golden Coral style of place. First off the place was nice, clean and had good service, and yes the servers do bring you drinks so no self serve here. As for the food this is what I found when we are breakfast:  The good-the honey ham from the carving station was great, as were the scrambled eggs, the breakfast sausage links and every desert and fresh fruit we tried. The desert station was all around great, especially the creme brule and cheesecake.  The OK- the French toast was so-so, as was the bacon, and yougert/granola station. The omlete station was pretty standard but was fine.  The bad- the only thing I had that was bad were the sausage patties, they were pretty dry and bland, go for the links which were great.  Overall we enjoyed the Golden Nugget buffet, the price and selection were perfect after a long night on the strip. If you are looking for lobster tails or organic milk then do us all a favor and go to the Wynn and stop bitching about places like this one.

jIqtwQh3apFlB39CCnQJog.text: The Buffet at the Golden Nugget is not the best buffet to be had in Las Vegas, the Strip hotels have better, much better, but if in Downtown, the Nugget Buffet is the best one. They serve all meals, breakfast, lunch and dinner and there is always some cross over so whenever you go, you will find something to eat. The price is reasonable considering the service and the quality of the food. There is usually a line but it moves very fast. We were seated for lunch in less than 3 minutes. Once seated a server is right there to get a drink order and to let you know about the buffet. They come by to clean up dishes and check on you. We loved the service, and very friendly as well. The selection is very large. From a great salad area to a cut meat area, they have it all. If you want Italian they have that, Asia, got ya, American, there is a ton of it. Their pies and cakes are super good. You will not be rushed and if you want to linger you can.  Children are welcome. Have a great time.

-uwVJm3zLCWTgBCLT71EjQ.text: We stopped by the Golden Nugget Buffet after getting off Big Bus Tours and cruising Fremont in the day time (best at night). The food was good. We actually used the dining room area instead of the Buffet. I purchased a meal that included a salad and desert from the Buffet. I think it was the Steak and Shrimp special. It also came with a baked potato and bread choice, I got the sour dough and it was very good. All of us ended up taking most of our food back the Hotel. It was a lot of food.

Cl8mgqEIawjU7gRqKsQflQ.text: I've been to almost all of the buffets at the big strip hotels, and paid over 70 bucks for some of them.  I wasn't planning on partaking in the GN buffet because of the poor yelp reviews. But I did out of hunger and convenance. I was pleasantly surprised. The food was just as good or better than others I've paid much more for. It was a great selection and everything I tried was fresh and at the appropriate temperature. Our server was an older gentleman named Frank. He was awesome. Very friendly, accommodating and funny. After our meal there we were sorry we didn't eat there more often. The only thing I wish the golden nugget would bring back is the steak and eggs midnight buffet. I remember years ago they offered that. It was always a full house and delicious.

vKbnp2XtZlHfYeUJp1QkAw.text: I love the nugget, but this was the disappointment of the weekend.  How can you charge $75 on a Sunday night for 3 people and the best thing on the menu is General Tso's Chicken - something they sell at Costco?  Sushi rolls are junk, Polska Kielbasa is... well sausage.  Can't even muster some BS ribeye... just tough ass beef jerky roast. In other words waste of money.   Run away fast!

4TMJSt8jKhoLkRH5Q1BWRg.text: If I could give less than one star, I would.   Started off at 4 Queens bell desk.  I asked the bell hop for a good place to eat.  He suggested the buffet at the the Golden Nugget because everything at the the Golden Nugget is top notch and the 4Queens is always playing second fiddle to them.  My wife and I walked over to the Golden Nugget Buffet.  Since it was the holiday, the price was more then usual ($23 per person).  The menu looked good, so I said, why not.  I should have went to McDonalds.  The food was cold and not good tasting.  The prime rib was raw (not rare).  They offered to throw it on the grill for me (gee thanks).  The only thing that was good was the server (Frank).  He was friendly and helpful.  In addition, they charged my credit card an additional $10 for no reason.  If you charge at the buffet, double check your credit card statement, they over charge for real bad food.

739njZDBtCyAdNdEOvygbA.text: I hadn't been to Vegas downtown in years, but always used to stay and eat at the GN, where their buffet was always hands down the best in downtown!  I finally got a chance to go back, looking forward to this dinner outing last Halloween after the parade, and took some friends.  Wow, was that the wrong decision, and it was just so disappointing; hard to believe this buffet is so bad now.  I heard ever since Steve Wynn sold the hotel operation, it's gone downhill--of course I hear this all now, when it would have been great to know beforehand.    Food was very mediocre at best, and table service was also on that par, even though the lady from Hawaii was very nice.  She got so distracted--and it wasn't even that busy--that she neglected us most of our time there.  Had to ask for drink refills all the time.  Food servers behind the counters were not all that friendly either.  Paying $26-27 for dinner on that Friday night for that service and food made me sick.  I would have rather had a hot dog at Coney Island!  Upon my return home, since I wasn't staying at GN, but on the strip, I wrote the management through the website, by email, and even by postal mail, direct to the hotel.  Here is my note:  As a long time (30+ years) patron and advocate of the Golden Nugget, I regret to say that I am extremely disappointed in our recent  dinner at your buffet (Halloween night).  I brought a party of four (My wife and another couple, our best friends) to eat dinner.  It was their first time, but my wife and I have eaten there many many times in the past years, however, we have not even been to Las Vegas in the past 10 years.    I assumed things would be excellent (quality, selection, service, etc.) as they always had been (historically).  That was far from the truth, and unfortunately it made me feel terrible for recommending the GN's buffet for our dinner that night, to my friends.  Food quality was the most disappointing, having no comparison to even the TI's buffet which we had the night prior.  Selection was rather limited and poor, and although table service was "ok" (lady from Honolulu), most of the servers behind the buffet stations were not very hospitable, energetic, or welcoming.  The dessert guy was the only exception.  I am scheduled to stay (with my wife and son) at GN in December, but I guess we'll not be eating at the buffet.  It's so disappointing that the quality of your hotel's buffet has gone down so much!  It was always the BEST in downtown!    We didn't try any of your other restaurants, but wonder about them.  In the past, we've tried Lily Langtree's, the Carson St. Cafe and a steakhouse (I believe), all of which used to be very good.   Now, I'm not so sure.  Anyway, I just wanted you to know about our disappointment.    ------ I never heard back in response at all!!  I guess they either don't care, or there are so many people complaining they don't have the time to respond to everyone.  WARNING:  GO AT YOUR OWN RISK!!  I WILL NEVER AGAIN.

ub2s-enwFrywKGcoClj29g.text: It got one star because they definitely serve food here. There's a reason they charge you in advance. Usually there are at least one or two standout dishes but this was all less than average. Norms would have been a better choice and would have cost 1/3 as much. Do yourself a favor; avoid this place like the plague.

-z0yXrwNsmDi7YhKxCsTHQ.text: We stopped in for breakfast one morning starving. The food is just average. You can't really mess up breakfast. The service was good and waitress was friendly. Not my first choice but if you are starved and don't want to leave the hotel. Swing on in.

La8EMQaewXIPEOW4Rs6Zkw.text: Value for money. We paid $30 for two people to eat lunch. I had very low expectations walking in but was rather surprised with their wide selection of options which ranged from Asian to Italian, Southern comfort food to a wide selection of pastries. If you're staying at the golden nugget hotel, you should def check this place out!

swez-DfK4X2Dxw9XJ-oxKw.text: I had a breakfast buffet here (they gave it to me for free as I was staying here) and it was acceptable but nothing more really. I used to come to the Golden Nugget often in the 90s and it was much better then. The choice was acceptable, I had some eggs Benedict that were significantly overcooked (probably had been sitting there for too long) and they don't have any options for lattes or cappuccino even with a surcharge. Not nice enough to return.

eCFZZ2QusCDTQ05Z09q1HQ.text: The initial waiting in line & payment process needs help but the food was good. Selection was decent. Went on Saturday for brunch and had to pay a little more than during the week but it was worth it compared to how cruddy the Stratosphere buffet was. Easy to get full and satisfied here. Amazing service as well. Just wish it didn't take so long to get a table and start eating.

_G9xycP4QKvOzQC6JjJhng.text: Nothing to write home about. It's your typical low budget buffet. I wasn't expecting to see an elaborate spread so I really didn't have high expectations. I should've lowered my "low" expectation. The reviews are mixed so we must've picked an off day to eat dinner here.   Nothing really stood out expect for the pizza alfredo which the pizza guy hand tosses and makes from scratch. Everything else was just blah. The roast beef was dry and tasteless. When the guy served it me, he practically flung it on my plate and looked angry. When I asked for the au jour sauce, he acted like it was inconveniencing him. I was handing him the bowl to put the sauce in but he ignored the bowl, grabbed my plate and dumped the sauce all over my food! Literally. I mean he didn't just put it on the meat, he put it all over my whole plate. Sheesh, who does that? My plate and the rest of my food was drenched.   The fried chicken which was now drenched in that sauce was also tasteless. The mashed potatoes were good, not fantastic but good and yes they were drenched in that dumb sauce too. Like I mentioned the pizza alfredo was really good. Even though it was drenched in that stupid sauce, I really liked it. In fact that's all I ate after that.  As for deserts. it looked very good but looks can deceive. The pastry guy was putting out new deserts and me being one who likes to talk to anyone (annoying right) told him the deserts looked awesome and asked him if they were made in house. He said they weren't and that they were bought at a store! LOLOLOLOLOLZ! OEM! I would never admit that. I did have a good laugh though. The deserts were dry. Nothing special.   Will I go back here? Probably not, oh wait, we did go back for breakfast which was pretty good. You can order your eggs how ever you want them. I ordered over medium and asked for 1 egg but the guy misunderstood me and made two. Not a biggie, but the funny thing is, he kept dumping the eggs and making new ones because he didn't like the way they had turned out. I kept telling him it was ok, but I guess he was a bit of a perfectionist...lol. Gotta love Vegas.

OzAuCzYz3scHGU5zDekNmA.text: Eh. I wasn't expecting too much out of this buffet but it was just, eh. There wasn't much to choose from! I really enjoyed the mac n cheese and potstickers. I was extremely disappointed when I grabbed a cheesecake that was like warm...yuck! Skip the buffet and go to Claim Jumper, it's open 24/7!

gNqYUPKGfZJycaZhCsi7xQ.text: Great buffet at a reasonable price and there desserts are awesome the bread pudding is a winner....

9BDYST-OO7VjMBCXwsKORQ.text: All I have to say is I wait in line and pay whatever it takes just to eat their spaghetti and meatballs! No joke I'm completely serious! I haven't had such good spaghetti at Italian food restaurants as I have here!

PVmNIvJQVYnY1gWrjxptGQ.text: I had the misfortune of dining there on 2/23/15 and left feeling ripped off. For the price, I was expecting good quality food, instead I got dry flavorless grub I had to force myself to swallow. The only thing with any flavor were the Italian meatballs thanks to the rancid Parmesan cheese. The service was great and staff friendly, but the food invited me to never go back.

O_8xdhn9BgSIf-ToKd6HdQ.text: It's just alright. Thanksgiving Buffett,  Turkey meat was very dry no taste or juice. Shrimp looked good. Desert were just okay, no exciting presentation.

Fl09EVLDPGx32MRaRg1vvw.text: I sincerely think the Golden Nugget and Fremont street are underrated.   My boyfriend and I came to the Golden Nugget for their champagne breakfast two days in a row. Not only was the food awesome, the mimosas were flowing, and our waitress serenaded us. And man oh man, she could sing! What a wonderful unexpected treat!   The buffet choices weren't overwhelming, and what items they did offer I felt they did well. The prime rib was tasty, the hot items were appropriately hot. The seafood section had fresh ceviche and peel and eat shrimp. The cream gravy they had for the biscuits and gravy and/or chicken fried steak was some of the best gravy i've had in a long time. The little mini egg rolls in the chinese food section were hot and crispy, and the corn beef hash was just right. The deli section had amazing smoked salmon and other deli meats...and the english muffins that pillowed the eggs benedict was crispy and not soggy! Bonus!  We will definitely make the trip back to the Golden Nugget for Champagne buffet! We've never received such amazing service at a buffet, ever. If Diane is working, ask for her! She is by far one of their hidden crown jewels. You won't regret it!

c9F_-EgdnJNGrqcpp2-CpQ.text: Not worth the $20! I'm a Las Vegas buffet connoisseur and had high hopes, since Golden Nugget is the crown jewel of downtown. I can honestly say I could not have been more disappointed. The quality of the food was OK, but the selection was abysmal! By far, the least amount of options of any buffet I've been to, which is 20 +.

CgYsNKvbCmR6JcEBjSJROw.text: Terrible. Worst buffet ever. It's what I would imagine a prison food line would be like. Nothing is good. Trust me. The sushi is miniscule, with gross rice; the roast beef was dry and grisly (spit it out in my napkin); fried shrimp, really? You know how you know it's a shitty buffet? You're eating salad. With box croutons. Really bad. Baaaaad. Go to Dupar's at the Golden Gate.

Bef_L4PULG-ZOP037ND4Kg.text: Chow mein and rice tasted like it had been out for a while. Egg rolls were so bomb along with the cheese cake. Pizza was good too.

bsRnk34q4IEOGwMpcRRz9g.text: Came here on Monday night for the buffet was told to try it out very disappointed it cost me $22.00 not much to choose from it looks real good, when I took my first bight from the Chinese BBQ chicken very dry, the regular fried chicken breast and drum stick dry, the fried shrimp and desserts were fine.  Not my place to eat.

a8jX2qwNpeHSWctbBpszbw.text: We were looking for a good place to eat preferably buffet in downtown and we ended up here and I'm really impressed the food were very good for the price we paid and our waitress was awesome.  She gave us everything we want so quickly.   Compare to paradise buffet in Freemont this is by far the best in downtown and the price is affordable.  I know for sure that we are coming back here now that we found em.

wFP8FSEX3uSgotanfg2aAA.text: We go every year for Mother's Day weekend. First, the wait staff is awesome! BUT, every year the food gets a little bit....worse. Many items were overcooked, dry and/or greasy. The omelets and carving station are the best part. The rest was, okay. Not horrible, but not great. Too expensive for the quality. And you have to pay for mimosas on top of the $25 a head to get in. Boo!

-9jeyntTJcsQk_TT-PRmkw.text: No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. Absolutely not. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No.   You can't be charging Strip buffet prices for crap food. Well, I mean you CAN do that and the Golden Nugget DOES do that, but you can't expect it to go unnoticed.  A dish of "steak" is filled with small cuts of very tough meat that are smothered with a sauce that is actually worse than the crappy gravies Heinz sells in a can.  The carving station turkey managed to taste like fish. It's a miracle, because I saw the guy cut the meat off of a turkey carcass. But it didn't taste like turkey.  Surely the pasta offerings would be better. Wrong. I think they fill their cheese ravioli with toe jam. It's terrible. Terrible.  I have a standing rule: I never rave about a restaurant's mac'n'cheese or mashed potatoes. I believe that those two items are simply impossible to screw up and none is truly as AMAZING as people claim. However, I can honestly report that the Golden Nugget Buffet's mac'n'cheese could very possibly be the worst ever created by human hands. Mushy, awful, chemically-tasting artificial cheesy nastiness. It's truly crap-tastic.  Do yourself a favor. Take the $25 per person that you would spend here and bet it all on black at the next roulette table you pass. It's a better value for your money.

RDwqH8ZwToMjvywMQ0aXuw.text: I was not impressed with this buffet especially with the price tag. I had better food at another buffet in a much less swanky casino. They need more variety, and waiting staff to be more attentive. The lady was very much so once she came back from her break. But I would expect more from the hefty price tag.

yG_E3UUYT8xcRR-q8kilMw.text: This  buffet was recommended to us, so we thought  we'd give it a try. Am not a fan of brunch, as I was in lunch mood. So I was not too happy not having full lunch menu. But I must  say this I was more then satisfied eating here. The quality of the food is great. You can tell they put effort into the meal, not just quickly thrown together. Ambiance is good. the buffet is not very big. Selection of food and deserts are good. I must  take  one star away for a few of the food items being a bit far in back, having to making a bit of a reach. For $18 and change i will definitely be returning.

syq5bv8RJq7eYTFCpW93Nw.text: This is the best buffet in Downtown Vegas.  There are better buffets on the strip, they cost a little more and are of a much higher quality. But for downtown, this is pretty good and a good value. Comparing it to the Strip is not fair. Compare it to the Main Street Station buffet and it is amazing.   Compare it to the Nugget's own Carson Street Cafe (a place that has gone downhill) and the buffet is amazing.

H4qySDJVEFXjWgGEMDdntQ.text: Got here an hour ago, still chewing 1st bite of prime rib

U4h_BqD5lMNVNviEPAXeyQ.text: Worst Buffet ever, poor service and nothing tasty, which cost you 30 bucks, better not choose this oneeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee!

Vmo9ZZrEw9SyDh9XcaIoHg.text: Rude people at the door won't take your credit card and then want to call the manager at this is stupid I'll go somewhere else and I'll never come back to this place

I41YMIJmQyBaZNmjy8R3aw.text: Yeah, not the greatest of buffets and a little pricey. I came for the crab legs and they're really dry. The rest of food not great either. Both Angela and I decided we're never coming back. Oh well.

QUXxIfFPTcIIOQTNPFK8fg.text: We went here for breakfast on a whim with very low expectations. We were pleasantly surprised. The food is simple but solid, the service was great. We thoroughly enjoyed everything. Eggs Benedict among best I've had in my life. Not flashy but doesn't have to be, just simple good food.

VyOKOIu4KRr9wrmmF_YljA.text: We decided to try out the breakfast buffet because we received a buy one get one free coupon when we checked in to our hotel.  We were worried that the food would be cold because we went about thirty minutes prior to breakfast ending.  We were happily surprised that the food was not only hot but it was very good.  There was an omelet station and a steam table with breakfast .   Our party of four was very satisfied and we all agreed that we would go back

78Nd-IqQcD96zjANPoISsA.text: Overpriced and inedible. I never need to go to prison to know how they're fed. Don't take the chance of eating here, it's about the worst food I've ever eaten. Maybe they cater to old people and smokers who don't have taste buds left.   1/10 would not eat again.

N8hz3FD9wW2fwod8QAR3xQ.text: Way overpriced!!! Horrible food!!! The buffet is tiny and has very small selection. What food they do have is terrible. The only thing I didn't mind was the bacon. But bacon is great anywhere. They only had shrimp in their seafood selection but I was too scared to try it. We don't drink, so the free mimosas were pointless.   The ONLY reason I gave it a star is the dessert bar. The fruit tart, cannoli, and cream pie were actually not bad.   Please, save your money and go someplace else. ANYWHERE ELSE BUT HERE!!!!!!!!

cUoe8dWbTSynjXCnjIfKgw.text: The golden nugget is a pretty neat hotel to visit downtown.. Its certainly one of the nicer ones (comparative to downtown hotels). We went to see the Gordan show and have dinner in their buffet. Man.. the buffet was horrible. The prime rib so scary rare.. the only two things I had was shrimp (which was way to soggy) and mac and chz.  Thats just sad for a Vegas Buffet.. we wont be visiting any of the eating places here again. (thank goodness I didnt try their expensive steak house)... Way to many awesome restaurants in Vegas to waste your time on anything under 4 starts..  The Highlight ?? Leaving .

KqDAgVqvfhy0lPkLP_b6bA.text: Overpriced small not worth going to wait service is slow most food was overcooked. better off going to main Street station or Fremont way better food and not overpriced like Golden Nugget

aVEAy7ZBV0ScCRBnoXCf6Q.text: I've now eaten here 3 or 4 times, the food was gross  every time I thought it would have gotten better, but not!!!! Everything from temperature to taste, never again!!!!

QIBZ1_T-ZblhAk1vjPYYsg.text: I really enjoyed this buffet 10 times more than the buffet at the "Wynn". Not to mention the price difference. I paid almost 15$ more at the Wynn for less of a variety that I personally was looking for. I like buffets that have a large salad variety, and don't focus so much on dessert!

jSvLqRsjqtl0L455_dftBA.text: Food was decent and so was the price.  A little worried when a guy behind us got into an argument with  the man behind us. Otherwise  yummy after a night of  partying.

SoqP6ymyZOg7bKhU-Yw3hQ.text: Come here often. . However,  lately the food hasn't been what it use too. The desserts I could have come across at a cheap $8 off strip buffet.  Crab was hit or miss.. shrimp under boiled. . And nothing looked as fresh as it once was.  I saddened to say I may not be back.

gOEK1IyKVQnXrEOvUuJm3A.text: Terrible. Don't do it. I checked in to get some work done and somehow ended up here despite prior experiences. My logic was that for $16.95 I could find something to fill my stomach and get back to work. WRONG. The sushi contained no fish. The roast beef had the texture of a Goodyear tire. The Italian food was so bad I am horrified to think of what they have done to the cuisine of my heritage. The chicken parm tasted worse than the dollar frozen food. The ravioli's were bad tasting mush and the sauce or gravy was pathetically prepared. After that the limited selections left next to nothing to chose from. A mall buffet in northern Wisconsin blows the selections here away. I next moved to the dessert hoping I would find something edible. WRONG. The deserts were bland and I tried several. One last point - at $16.95 this would have been a very bad mistake. Actually it was 28.95 plus tip.  To be fair the workers were all very great. Friendly attentive excellent service. They made for the perfect contrast. Landry's shame on you.

lp_S73pz1i609wbJ0tpcGg.text: Over priced for breakfast. A $5 discount for kids 4-8 is sad. Less than friendly hostesses and wait staff especially first thing in the morning.

60I4QzwOt6wtMI3u7r1yoA.text: Well, it's cheap. Both in and price, as well as quality.  The bacon is soggy, the eggs appear to be powdered, and the gravy, is definitely from a can. The biscuits were alright however. As well as the French Toast.  The omelet station is pretty nice, but the cooks' tongs kept flying from bin to bin, when he scooped up ingredients.  Fruit looked fresh, and pastries are "ok"  However, the price is cheap.

nLvpwGQYP1dOsRqi75dSQQ.text: Very disappointed in the food.  First of all, if you go on the weekends and you have a coupon for a free meal with your stay you have to pay the difference in price on the weekend which was never disclosed.  We tried their breakfast and there was a lot of food to chose from.  Since I am vegetarian I opted for scrambled eggs, potatoes and fruit.  The scrambled eggs and potatoes were cold and it did not taste right.  I decided to have a custom omelet which at least I watched my food getting cooked and that was decent.  My husband however tried the scramble eggs and sausage but couldn't finish his meal.  Not too long into the day he got sick and felt like he got food poisoning from breakfast.  It was very unfortunate.

08F2ufHPLiwHEW-zaS3OCA.text: Totally three stars, but that's what I was expecting here anyway. We ended up here because we were too lazy to find something better (we were walking 15 miles a day on the strip, whew). The breakfast type stuff was pretty good. The meats were all over cooked. The Chinese dishes were super salty. Only one out of the seven desserts we tried was very good. That was the chocolate espresso mouse cake. We were wishing we ate $20 worth of just that, each. Oh well. Not bad but... never again! ;)

jLDqvKKw6T_ybLLYAUQ65A.text: I went there for lunch today and it was $16 for the buffet. This definitely is not the Bellagio Buffet (which is around $34) and you sure know it. It's pretty basic but covers your needs. You get a salad bar, dessert bar, cold food/sandwiches, and hot sections. They had a small asian cuisine section that was ok. I'd say Panda Express is much better and cheaper. They had bbq today and the friend chicken was so over cooked that it clinked against the metal bowl it was in when I dropped a chicken leg. I ended up passed on it. They also had bbq beef which was really dry and not that great.  Honestly, the entire time I was eating my lunch I wish I had just walked down the block to White Castle and gotten some chicken sliders. It would've been cheaper and I would've been happy.  The apple cobbler and scoop of ice cream for dessert was tasty.  The wait staff was very nice and the ladies working the register were also very nice.   Again. If you have one buffet to go to while in Vegas, do yourself a favor and go to the Bellagio Buffet. You'll pay more but it's worth it for the quality of food you'll be eating.

b5W9pBUvf0lkk4kr3lyn_A.text: I got to try their buffet for breakfast, lunch, brunch, and dinner at different times during the week of my stay. For a buffet I am impressed. They have an assortment of choices and they change a few food selections around each day so it was nice not to have the exact same foods all the time. The bread pudding is a favorite amongst the family. A must for all to try. It's more like a bread custard. So good. Of course my favorite is the desert section, so many selections of cakes to try. My favorites is the Boston cream cake. My son, who is a very picky eater, ate well and health (until desert) at the buffet. I recommend the brunch so you get breakfast and lunch foods at the same time, and dinner once.

upGK879a-CkDqF7Bli8mdw.text: I was going to eat seafood Here with my boyfriend for seafood night and my hair was a platinum blonde because I'm celebrating a birthday they embarrassed me called over the manager to ask if my outfit was ok to eat there below is. Picture of my outfit was very rude and embarrassing made me feel like I was cheap and disgusting all because I had on a blonde wig because it Vegas and I thought It would b a cool new look very rude and nasty I would never eat here it was inappropriate the way I was treated and I'm currently staying in the hotel

ka-r9Wo7UsZapBv620NH7Q.text: Foods delicious, very good price brunch is 16.99+tax  and locaition is the  best . Waitress Elba is so helpful and nice person. I recommend this place if you looking good buffet place..

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Nugget Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WjI0l42uRz3kqI_C3EEhcQ.text: When one thinks of Golden Nugget on Fremont St they may think of a nice place and a buffet to eat at. Well dont expect much from this place, we visited here after hearing they have a good buffet. I was disappointed that the food was very limited and not refilled its like they wait until the see someone "Scrapping the bottom of the pan" just to get something. There was no line on a Saturday evening, usually a buffet would be packed especially on Saturday night. I would probably not come back here again, I am glad I tried them once, that was enough for me. I will go to others and try. I think they really need to work on their food quality and customer service skills, to keep people wanting to come back. I think when a buffet has no line on a Saturday evening that must tell one something. The place was clean around the table area, but the buffet area could've had some work to it.

ncCiLw5LuYjIOykIZY1OWg.text: The waitress was super friendly and sweet she gets 5 stars! The buffet was super expensive and wasn't good at all. No selection. The only seafood was shrimp on ice. Super disappointing for all the hype I heard about Vegas buffets.

kVjBPERcdAE23nKZyZFb3A.text: This place was pretty awful. The omelette station, the one thing my girl and I actually wanted, was closed a half hour early for no reason. The scrambled eggs had a weird slime. Zero gluten free options, and I'm not saying gluten free bread or anything like that, I mean, they didn't even have jello or pudding!  Then there was the omelette station worker that sexually harassed my girlfriend multiple times, every time she was in the food area, commenting on how pretty she is, her beautiful eyes, telling her she made his day, following her around and generally making her very uncomfortable. He should be fired immediately. #timesup  For 18 bucks, this place is the worst. Go elsewhere.

Xe-U2Tvr_9-OMo831WhiRw.text: It doesn't even fit in with all the other delicious food in the hotel.  It should be closed.  We were there for dinner.  The food quality was about as good as a school or hospital cafeteria, and I have been to better hospital cafeterias.  Golden Corral is probably 10 times better and half the price.  Dinner was 26 dollars a person.  I'm not wanting to sound bitter in this review, but I want to give potential customers a chance to make another choice.  The service was good.  The waitress was attentive and kind.   If you want you want to here it from someone else Just watch the faces of people people coming down the escalator if you dont believe me or even ask one of them.

3NpfjHL0S73X48kxSZZ6Yw.text: Do not waste your money on the buffet!!! The moment I sat down I was sorry. The waitress come over to get our drink order and was RUDE. Such a limited selection, and what was there was gross! I have never had such dry, pink, wet, prime rib. The only thing on the whole buffet that had any flavor...the capers! Then when my daughter spilled her drink all over the table. No one on staff lifted a finger to aid in the clean up. We were scrambling for napkins off neighboring tables.

mqIF572QH4y0Wmh25F70gw.text: This buffet has a little less to offer than most Vegas buffets for the price. We ate on a Friday night and they did have good crab legs, big shrimp and shrimp scampi which was excellent. The roast beef was good (but not great) and the desserts were good. I think the biggest issue is just that there are not as many dishes available to choose from as many other buffets at the same price. In addition, just some little things like no hand wipes after eating the crab legs, no hot butter available for the crab, and no pizza available to eat at the time we were looking.  However, the food is better quality than bottom bargain buffets, so you shouldn't avoid this place if you need dinner.

eob1FXA-JUWzwYkWJj9wsQ.text: This buffet is 25 bucks on the weekends and not worth it. They didn't have English muffins or  dip/sauce for the egg rolls, and the mix of food was just weird. They had ceviche but no tortillas or chips. All their crab is imitation and you can tell they don't make any of their baked good there, they just ship it in. Overall just gross and an odd mix of food that makes you wish you spent your 25 bucks elsewhere.

1C-Z6ezcRNdBJa6iYNBAZQ.text: Came here over the weekend. Overall a nice experience.  Friendly staff. I go for the snow crab legs when I'm in Vegas. Friday night.  Believe the reviews when people complain the crab legs are over cooked and dry. Pretty flavorless.  However... if you can do it (which I'm ok with) they have cold selection.  Big juicyn chilled flavorful snow crab. (Dipped in hot butter) Prime rib was ok. Good salad.  Good desserts.  Not bad for the price.  I'd return but of course it's not comparable to your $75 buffets on the strip. I think Wynn is still my favorite for snow crab.

zQCekbFsARTXzAFgbQB2sg.text: I had actually written a good review on this place because it's been great before. I went there with my son and literally everything was horrible. Bagels hard as a rock, bacon tasted weird, rice pilaf? Lol the only good thing was the donut, which they get from Krispy Kreme's. I can't believe they serve this food to the public. I used to love this buffet for years but it's went downhill in the worst way. What a bummer!

FPYCZ-nvSxXvRoMHhKULWg.text: It is the worst so disappointed never again it's disgusting I recommend not to ever come here it's nasty the workers are so rude and they never come to ask if you need a refill in drinks the food has no flavor

UlTkiR14EchdPc-pcb5QTQ.text: I've previously came here the year before and my experience was overall mediocre. The food was eh and the service was decent. I just got to Vegas a little bit ago and came to the buffet. Keep in mind I was very hungry after a 6 hour drive from California. I thought it would be lunch but it was brunch so lots of breakfast foods not what I was hoping for nor did they inform me. I made do with what they had and I regret it very much. I feel sick to my stomach and my friend was disgusted that our server had snot hanging out of her nose. I barley finished my plate and my friend and sister took 2 bites of salad and couldn't take another bit due to the thought of the waiter. We asked for the manager he immediately came over and talked to us. We told him what happened, he said he would talk to the waiter but we didn't want to cause a problem. We just wanted a refund for our bad experience.  He walked away and we believe he talked to the waiter. We were expecting him to come back but didn't. We waited 15 -20  minutes before going to the front desk to ask again. At this point I wanted to run straight to the room to get sick. We asked for the manager again and the kind lady at the front desk said he'll be here in 1 min... We kept waiting and in my mind about to throw up got very impatient and asked for the manager again the lady called him again and his phone went straight to voicemail.. He popped up behind us and rudely gave us a refund. He made it clear he didn't want to. The cash register lady asked what the refund was for and he rudely said "they didn't like the food". I'm sorry sir but would you like us to say very loud that our waiter had snot hanging a mile long from her nose, to the point of my friend thinking it touched her food on the table? I wouldn't think so. I definitely won't be going back here after feeling like shit.

3m_CtNAFbScGcMyMiUfT_Q.text: The biscuits, chicken fried steak and country gravy were delightful. The standard fare of sausage, bacon, hash browns was here along with grilled veggies. Overall, it was a satisfying meal. Service performed well. We were seated promptly and they refilled our drinks in a timely fashion.  I am giving this place a low star rating because of 3 items that ruined this Vegas buffet experience beyond repair. 1. Coffee- This was the worst coffee I have ever tasted. Was it even coffee? It tasted like bitter muddy water. 2. Breakfast steak- It tasted like freeze dried meat you get out of a military MRE. I nearly vomited after putting this abomination in my mouth. 3. Canned fruit- Come on guys. You can't get fresh fruit?

AIw1yzKtuOpIReDRqmmfjg.text: Service is good the food is fair. Nice variety of desserts. But the main coarses include a lot of pizza and sandwiches- yes sandwiches and chips - might as well go to subway.

MgDJSDGMxSNebzwCh_s97Q.text: I've been here before but won't be back again.   Very mediocre and overpriced. Service couldn't be worse. After a long wait I finally had to ask someone who wasn't my waitress to bring coffee.  Never saw a waiter again.  Egg white omelet wan not cooked through. Pastries were dry.   Needless to say they won't see me again.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Nugget Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WvezgvTRPdKKH3pcsYGTpg.text: The dinner buffet on Monday was mediocre at best and we got there at 730pm.  It was way over priced with the minimum options for food.  They advertise sushi and the products they used mostly came out of cans like tuna or crab.  The bbq was dry and overcooked.   The Chinese food was good but far from authentic...like the Mongolian Beef was tasty but white onions not green onions.  The white steamed rice was crispy like when it's left in a hot pan without water.  The Italian food was okay but the pizza was cheap on dough and cheese.  The best part was the omelet bar.  Fresh ingredients made to order.  I love buffets and always go back for seconds...this was the first ever time I didn't go back.  PS - the service was awesome though.  Our drinks were always full.

XiQKwJCXPm5xQVLpg1XOqQ.text: By far the greasiest food ever, couldn't even finish one plate before my gf and I got sick. Even the mimosas were gross and water downed, how hard is it to use real oj? Spend a little more and go to the Bellagio

LQqWITqBRSaExznDeI7SEw.text: Located in the Golden Nugget on Fremont Street in Downtown Las Vegas. tHis is the best buffet in the downtown area,(keep in mind that is the equivalent to being the best kosher deli in North Dakota). That being said I was there for breakfast, everything was fresh. Here is what sets them ahead in the downtown area, lox, thats right I said lox at a cheapie buffet, and steak, thats right I said steak! They also put the salad bar out, a lot of places don't do that for breakfast. Live it up you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

cxj3yyjd1xo4T5OEbg0Fug.text: We were pretty hungry by the time we got to Golden Nugget on our way out of town. We opted to try the buffet, begrudgingly. I've never been a huge fan of buffets as they are typically disappointing and filled with loads of marginal food. My SO on the other hand, loves buffets.   We were pleasantly surprised! Perhaps it was that we weren't expecting much, but for a Sunday brunch at $16.99 this place was pretty good. Here are the highlights:  Scrambled eggs were really delicious, mixed with ham and peppers. Country gravy was traditional and very flavorful Linguisa sausage was spicy Pizza sausage (my SO liked this although I thought it was ok) Ranch dressing on the salad bar was the yummy kind Corned beef hash was pretty tasty Tater tots were yummy If you like macaroons these ones are seriously very very good.  Some of the things that were a miss: the desserts were very bland and we were unimpressed for the most part. Except the macaroons which were delish.  There isn't a lot of variety but I was so full so quickly and for the price it was really quite good.   They had shrimp cocktail and peel and eat shrimp, both of which were nothing special. And there fruit was very typical. There was nothing special on the salad bar either.  The food itself was pretty well seasoned though and for mass production buffets this place was honestly, better tasting than the buffets I've experienced at The Rio, Paris, Flamingo or anywhere else on the Strip.   The service was decent too.     If you are downtown and hungry, I'd say go for it.

VGN0oiB-3wjgnDPMOIWc0A.text: Lots of buffets to choose from in Las Vegas.  This is probably the only one I would try in the downtown area.  The place seemed clean and the food was good.  The selection could be better, but is decent.  This particular night the service was not great.  It took a while for drink refills and a long while for plates to be cleared away.  At $24 for dinner, it's not a bargain, but it's not really out of line either.  It would be a nice deal at about $18.

C1VvcvwTQh6u3e-URdwGrA.text: The salad bar, fruits and desserts were the best part of the buffet.  The service was very good also.  The prime rib didn't have much flavor, although the ham was juicy and tasted like honey baked ham.  The steamed clams were very dry and difficult to chew.  My son-in-law loved the fried shrimp and had several servings of that.

QNBLAHjlUzJNwDry7eahng.text: Before you go to this buffet, stop, look at the coupon book that you got when you checked into the hotel, and find the 2 for 1 buffet coupons.  They are good for breakfast and lunch and our book came with two of them.  This buffet is good but not worth full price.  There's not much to say about this place other than the food is very average.  The buffet itself is relatively small, so there isn't a huge amount of variety.  If you're looking for a better selection, I'd recommend going in 15 minutes before they switch from breakfast to lunch.  That way you pay the breakfast price and get to choose whether you want to eat breakfast food, lunch, or some combo.  If you're there for breakfast time, I do recommend the omelet station.  I was surprised to see they had eggs Benedict as well, but it was nothing to write home about.  Overall, I'm giving this place three stars rather than two only because of the 2 for 1 coupon.  I would never pay full price to go here but it is a good value at half price.

dHKjOIcJk44lgGc0n67Drw.text: Food was either bland or overseasoned. I get that buffets are for the masses, but damn...its like the cooks don't care

RKjuxV6HhrUJtuocyHXijw.text: We came here for brunch. It's just like any hotel and casino buffet. The server was friendly and we were even greeted and attended to by the manager.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Nugget Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs benidict, strawberry waffles &amp; french toast.

xpf7acA_nayqEvrtHqOCAg.text: I admit I was hesitant to eat here based on the average score, but reading recent reviews changed my mind, and I am so glad for it!  I rely on Yelp reviews to help determine where I might eat when away from home, so I wanted to add one here in support of the Golden Nugget Buffet. We had dinner around 7:30 on a Sunday - no wait to be seated. Plenty of freshly prepared food to choose from. I had prime rib, mashed potatoes, veggies, orange chicken, meatballs, and a couple other things that I could fit on my plate. Everything was hot and delicious. The orange chicken was crispy on the outside, tender breast meat on the inside. Prime rib was perfect for anyone's taste - I had an end cut that was so tender, but there was rare as well for those who prefer that preparation.  There was also a made-to-order pasta bar that looked great, but I was already loaded up with so much else!  My teen boys were in heaven with the large selection of items they enjoyed. Ravioli, short ribs, peel and eat shrimp (deveined and split for you), fried shrimp, sausage and peppers, and of course, the desserts which included hand dipped ice cream in 10 or so flavored to choose from.   The price point was fair and the service from our waiter was perfect. I am so glad I didn't travel to the Strip and spend three times as much - I don't know how it could have been better!

ozxzQe57EYXaRQHfZuf-vw.text: Goddamn, that prime rib is RARE AS SHIT.   Pretty trashy as far as food goes, and $20 a person. Skip this one and go to the Bacchanel at Caesar's Palace for a more expensive buffet, but will be an unforgettable experience.

ccRbDSBdcuMB-JTAt4Wikg.text: Recent visit, very disappointing, the guy cutting the beef has no customer service skills and needs to be reported to his management. Older mexican guy who the Nugget can't get rid of and he knows it. When my son asked him about the meat selection he responded with "this is all we have" not answering the question and the topper was I overheard him speaking to the sushi chef complaining about an Asian customer who had limited english in which he had a difficulty hearing and arrogantly had to asked her to speak english. This guy ruins it for the rest of the hard working staff.

NuqfPz0yL0m0a6uAdWLZ0A.text: A reasonable $15 was spent on a lunch buffet. Fresh food- salad, fish, etc. Brisket was a hit or miss. Some of my party liked it and others thought it was too greasy. Pork loin, pizza, Mac and cheese, and desserts were all on point.

D_oKXKH3stEN-axBilOiZA.text: Expensive for the quality. My husband and I decided to make it easy this morning by trying the Golden Nugget's breakfast buffet. The eggs benedict were hard boiled. Dry. No extra hollendais... I asked. Shrimp, soggy with very little taste. Canned peaches better than fresh fruit. Dry pastries. They do have made to order omlettes. Best item I had. Salmon with capers, tomatoes, thin sliced red onion. My husband did like the blintzes and the banana cream pie. Not worth the calories nor the money.

h8CPwhJydk4SFUjQcP2spw.text: We've eaten at many breakfast buffets in Las Vegas and although some of them have more variety, none of them were tastier than the Golden Nugget.  It's kind of hidden away on the second floor which maybe helps with the long lines, we walked right in both times.  The omelette guy actually seemed to love his job and deposited my perfect creation with a smiling "Viola!".  Saying happy stuff in French makes my food taste better - science.  The waiter and waitress were attentive for a buffet and a great meal was made better!

XEhZloRycaUbQCMBjfwWAw.text: This brunch buffet is very hit or miss. Several yummy items like collards, roasted vegies, General Tai chi ken, kielbasa, apple cobbler, but several terrible selection, hard hard eggs benedict, super tough and dry brisket, bla corned beef hash. Slow service. Not coming back here.

t3lXwtNeEfu7SjLWypBhGg.text: The buffet here is just ok. That goes for the food and the service with one exception, Rene Martinez. Rene Martinez is a shining start hidden among mediocrity. He went way out of his way to make my daughter's experience amazing, as well as our own. His upbeat and happy attitude is infectious. He is seems to be the epitome of customer service. All said and done, the buffet here is worth a stop if you do not want to spend a lot or head to the strip.

4fUhq0XJBo6d-oihD0NWGA.text: It's only fair that we compare this to all the other similar buffets out there.   For $17.99 lunch, it's hard to compare this to strip buffets because they are $25 minimum and most are $30+.   This buffet should be compared to Palms or Red Rock buffet. Compared to those locations, Golden Nugget falls middle to the lower-end. The prime rib and fresh cut meat keeps the comparison alive, but nearly every other item is difficult to swallow. This is coming from a guy who was forced fed old food due to my family's difficult financial situation.   Every processed dessert is near inedible. I'm a guy who used to count calories and eat a well-composed diet. Whenever I do eat refined sugary items, I expect deliciously tasting sugars and corn syrup. You won't find that here.   Come here to get nourished but don't expect to eat lavishly.

cdBK1Zal7gQGawR8wZoBUg.text: To set your expectations, this buffet is nothing compared to the buffets on the strip (I'm sure you already know that, but in case you didn't)  My mom and I originally planned on going to a buffet on the strip, but got lazy and decided to hang around the downtown area where we were staying.   We walked right in on a Wednesday during dinner time with lots of open tables.   We received great customer service.  If not for our awesome server, I would have given 2 stars. Dinner was around $25 or $26 for weeknight dinner. I think the rate changes for  weekends.   There was not much to choose from.  I did enjoy the Mongolian Beef and fried shrimp and the dessert selection was decent.   Overall, If this was the only option then go for it, otherwise you could probably find a better place for dinner.

u2bcBdyR79jwsJRSEmlRfw.text: Like every Buffet you go to now. Expensive, fast food.   The omelet bar was the freshest takeaway.   But really can you mess up an omelette bar?  But the place smells like an ashtray.  Wouldn't recommend it for the price.

MQlRIyVz-EU1GTTVM20WLg.text: So much food so little time. The price is right and the food is good. No mater what you can find something you like at this buffet.

ymNGUrAk4ju1oBejYkNb4g.text: I don't know what's up with the low stars, but this is the best buffet I've ever had in my life. Not that I've had a ton of them, but this is the best.   It's not cheap, but the food definitely tasted high quality to me. When I go to a buffet I like to try a little bit of everything, but I don't like to waste food. We typically go to buffets at the end of breakfast so they are starting to put lunch out and we can get the best of both.   What I like about Vegas is they know they're a tourist town so they know they have to please people from everywhere. They can't just serve American food and do that right. They have to be able to please palates from around the world. That's not easy. What I found most frustrating for most of my stay in Vegas was the lack of accommodation for customers, but at this place they at least try to have some options available (sugar free desserts? OMG!)  Start with breakfast. Are these powdered eggs? They didn't taste like it to me. And the potatoes were definitely fresh. The bacon was crispy and not greasy. They also had eggs Benedict, delicious grits (OK, not Alabama or Georgia delicious, but good,) prime rib, omelets, pies and cakes of all sorts, seafood, biscuits and gravy, pancakes, french toast, you name it. I'm hungry again already.

wTyhRDEZBbwEvbRdYsnlyw.text: I was staying at the Golden Nugget for 4 nights for work and came here one night for dinner which cost about $25.   I was seated quickly and while the buffet is small I don't mind that. I think that means more turnover on the food so it's not sitting there in giant trays forever.   There's a salad bar section in the center with a U around it with some cold cuts, cheeses and giardiniera, sandwiches, then the hot stations with Italian, meats/carving station, Chinese, American comfort food, then a chilled shrimp station and deserts.   I was sat facing the buffet and watched as the staff refilled several stations so that was good. I started with the antipasti station and the cheese and proscuitto were very nice and there was a good selection of pickled vegetables. Then I got a plate of carved prime rib which at best was medium. It didn't seem like there was a medium rare piece on it but it was still tender and juicy.   The chilled shrimp were fine. They were definitely brought in frozen already deveined and split but tasty enough. The dessert section was probably the highlight with a wide selection and an ice cream section.   Most of the pastries and desserts were pretty good except for their "creme brulee" which wasn't bruleed at all and just had some sugar syrup poured on top which wasn't even caramelized so it wasn't even like a flan.   It was totally fine and I think the small stations help keep the food fresh because it doesn't seem to be that busy on weekdays.

TjdBxyMSomJz-QBK7_uiHg.text: Ok so this is not a fancy Vegas Buffett of the strip, that's for sure.  With that said it's pretty fairly priced, the food is mediocre, but the prime rib is good. I say skip it and take the plunge on the strip, you will be happier.  If you are looking for a more affordable option then go for it.

X21K2lZcvfMWvJBmCJqjDw.text: Stopped by this buffet after my supervisor suggested it. The food was pretty good, the servers were attentive and the establishment was clean compared to most other buffets I've been to (not just in Vegas, but in general). Sure,  the food was pretty much your typical comfort food, but it was delicious and filled me up. Also, I liked the sugar free ice cream since I try to avoid sugar as much as I could. I got what I paid for.

rCMy7gQEkCT_9MufWTghvg.text: Went here for seafood night specifically for crablegs. I didn't want to make the trek to the strip or pay strip prices I just couldn't do it! Every year for my bday my husband takes me to a buffet for crab legs, we've gone to Bellagio buffet for the last few, I've also been to Baccanal at Ceasars Palace and Samstown buffet before they got rid of crab night. For the price point Golden Nugget Buffet is the best, if you wanna eat your weight in crab legs, this is the place! Literally all I want is a bomb ass salad,endless crab legs and iced tea. And that's exactly what I got! The quality isn't bad in my opinion. It IS a buffet so always keep that in mind. To some extent all buffets are going to be cheap quality. Our bill was 62 bucks for 2 people plus we left a tip, our server was nice, they actually serve you to drinks ( unlike Bellagio that has those fancy coke fountains that are self serve, I hate those! Hate them!). They give you a bucket and crab cracking tools. They had a caprese salad I was super impressed with and HOT crab legs that are whole and not just cold ones that are spilt in half. The hot ones are way better and I prefer them whole. I am a very happy camper and I will never go all the way to the strip for crab legs again. Finding self parking was a bit of a pain but they do validate if you eat there so it was free! I will be back, I don't understand the bad reviews at all. It is small, yes, for sure, but what they have is good and again if you just want a crab night this is the place on Friday nights. I'm super satisfied.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Nugget Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That tomato mozarella salad was BOMB! I could eat it all day! Friday Seafood night 2019

Photo of Golden Nugget Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad station Friday seafood night August 2019

pnofuc0vpESsMM07LAT-0g.text: Good meal choose for the price...good servers and the food are tasty ...they have cheese selection and prime rib...they are just a simple buffet ...

IEUmwhoI8eJMf8mzQS9r7Q.text: We went for brunch on Sunday morning and there was a wide variety of food options. There was a bloody Mary bar and Chinese, meats, breakfast, fruits, desserts, all kinds of pastries, custom made Omelettes, you name it they had it. All of the food seemed fresh and hot. The buffet for brunch was $25 per person but the hotel offers buy one get 1 free. The service was a little slow getting drinks refilled but it was decent. I would definitely eat at this buffet again or try it for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Nugget Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Round two
Photo of Golden Nugget Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lots of options

VTJ1MVSnkN1PsHfheuHPjA.text: We came here on a Wednesday and I think for both dinner buffets it was less than $50.00.  I was shocked to see this place alive and full of people. I was thinking of those Cinema -old school Downtown buffets for all you can eat for 9 dollars -lol   We got there around 6ish and the food tasted fresh and was served hot. Nothing dry or stale here. I think the Chinese section was my favorite. the cook there was very funny and kept making jokes with me and my wife. He made this buffet very enjoyable.   My favorite was the Chinese dumplings and the meatballs. We normally Eat at the Caesars Buffet so I am not comparing it to that. I am giving this place 4 stars for the value and atmosphere/customer service.   Our waitress was awesome, we had some mimosas and we were not rushed out at all. This will be our go to buffet when we are downtown.  Much better than the Fremont Casino - Paradise Buffet.

mmiEVmQvyiC1PHtfIyDBsg.text: Two Friday night Buffet dinners-$72. ( included seafood) While the buffet has seafood- cold or hot crab legs and quite the assortment of items, the food quality just isn't there. Peel and eat shrimp was soft and rubbery, the crab legs - neat wouldn't come out if legs whole.. as it stuck to the walls of the shell and fell apart in the middle.  Oysters were over breaded and over deep fried and the very thin whole clams had to be peeled out of shell.  Shrimp scampi and sausage were the best parts of the buffet.  Wait staff was prompt on clearing plates and getting beverages.

JvnOrvvBZBTD9vrT-thJIg.text: We spent a night in old Vegas at the Golden Nugget and went for brunch. It was 17 dollars a person which isn't bad for a Vegas buffet, but the buffet is tiny. You expect a grand buffet in Vegas, but this one was smaller than one was half the size of one you'd see at a chain buffet.   Our waitress didn't take our drink order until after we had gotten our food and been sitting for a few minutes. She forgot half of our drinks and when asked for more water, she brought us soft drinks.  The breakfast buffet ends at 10:30 and lunch starts after that and so I would recommend getting there at 10 and experiencing the best of both worlds. The desert was the highlight of my buffet.
