FCou4WCe8t91lIz6Wx35BA.text: Food is delicious! And the service is wonderful they're very attentive to your every need. Great price for all the options offered, lower than the buffers on the strip.

hUl-PTAPfNPaoimyDYtQHQ.text: Love this place every time I come to Vegas and I also tell my friends about the price is great not to high or to low for a buffet this is my stop I highly recommend ..

-pYJD9lE8D7cuxMBVpLFoQ.text: This was an excellent buffett. Although the amount of choices were limited as opposed to some of the bigger buffets, the items they had were exceptional. I will say that this is the only buffet I've seen with collard greens available, which were very good. The prime rib was cooked perfectly and the fried rice was very good. The desserts that were available, carrot cake, red velvet cake, and a strawberry shortcake pie, were all excellent. There were many more foods available but I couldn't have eaten another bite.

PReCt7Vq-nXHVgXhc_VS6A.text: The breakfast buffet was absolutely delicious, plenty of different choices for everyone. The Bloody Mary bar was hit . I would definitely come her again .

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Nugget Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bloody Mary bar was awesome

dFHfURUNXQXKypQwS0cY5g.text: I'd give a 3.5 because the service bumps them up, but the fact they dealt with 16 of us at a table and got us into our own space to sit with one another, we'll go up to a 4. When I called and spoke to the manager to get our party a reservation she couldn't have been nicer and more accommodating. Of course, a big thumbs up there.  First, don't expect a buffet the size of the ones you'll find on the Strip. Nor should you expect the quality. You'll be disappointed if you do.  It was a Wednesday night, so no crab legs. Drinks took awhile. The food in general was average. I did enjoy the turkey breast, though it was a bit dry. The peel and eat shrimp did seem to be deveined - so kudos to them on that. It was a bit soggy, though. The cheese selection was limited, though the prosciutto seemed high quality and the baguette was fresh. I also liked the ground mustard and chutney they had out.  Overall, a fun time. I might go back on another night, but won't be a regular spot when I'm in the area.

r4Ztk_leZmCBUr1o4ixLMw.text: Yuck. Everything was dry. The chicken, the macaroni, the mashed potatoes, the cheese on the pizza, even the deserts. The salad bar only has iceberg lettuce. And flavorless. Wish i could get a refund..

q8lJFVQBaIAUIuPZCNHqpw.text: I'll be back. went there for lunch/ dinner. great shrimp,cuke salad, made to order omlents, great desserts.

gdAHJ2Gm1MBsV_AHawM48g.text: I stopped in here with a group of 6 for a Sunday Champagne Brunch. For $20 you get the buffet offerings and unlimited champagne or mimosas. I think I lucked out we got to choose between both breakfast and lunch foods because I like to sample a little of each. I'm not usually a buffet-goer but overall I really enjoyed started our morning this way.   There were typical breakfast offerings like bacon, sausage, potatoes and a bagel bar with smoked salmon (I passed), cream cheese and capers. I liked that they offered eggs benedict (overcooked, but oh well) and some of our party did the build-your-own omelette and seemed happy with it.   The food was ok. I hear there are definitely some awesome buffets in Vegas, but if you're over in Downtown Vegas and don't want to make the trip to the strip, this is a pretty good option (if you get the champagne included).

XSkgTxLbxfaicwh0-5GpLQ.text: This buffet was the WORST buffet/resturant I have ever been to!  The meat was dry, the potatoes were cold and the selection of food options was just sad.  When we complained the manager didn't even comp the meal.  Just a terrible experience.  One bright side, the waitress was very friendly.

gfRtxe0p5ox88xjeJd6kLg.text: This was so nasty I would never go back there was hair on the napkins it looks like my cat rolled around on it The seats are so close that you can't get out to get more food without hitting the person behind you I complain and nothing was done very expensive for not very good food and not very good service never go back again I spent a lot and only had a bowl of pasta that's was the only nice thing is the pasta lady was supper nice but the manager was very rude

S9fwbwIv357wDJPnA5dT_g.text: Yes if you read Walters review then you will know I am from San Diego as well and WOW are we spoiled! This buffet rivals the Laughlin buffet I reviewed before.....  Restaurant Clean and modern would what I saw and expected it to be in worse condition, yet I was surprised. Service was prompt and they tried there best....  Buffet Small, diner food, and small....oh I said that already. The crab legs were small and uninviting. The Chinese food was bland. No flavor in the pasta as well. The fountain coke was water down.   Tips 1. If you don't care about quality and are staying at this casino then eat there to feel full.  2. The check in will take longer than expected so eat there, if you are in a rush, and then check in.

u4ZXblshi1bZA-ZG4kXZgA.text: Pros: Clean place. Great server. Food selection was about right for the amount you pay.   Cons: Salty cod fish.  I informed the manager about the salty cod fish that is somehow untolerable and let my boyfriend tasted it and he agreed that it was way too much.  Good thing about this place is that they mean business. He called the chef to speak to me and explain this and that.. once you complain, they will offer you a new batch of that specific food you complained and kept on offering me something which I don't have any interest at all. But overall, I like the fact that they were so being serious about what they do and will do everything for customer satisfaction. So, good job on this one!

EFdYKtyb5IM5LYyo28EVEA.text: This was my first buffet experience in Las Vegas, and I was amazed at the variety, quantity and quality of the food. It was Thanksgiving and they not only had the usual Thanksgiving offerings, but Oriental and Italian, among others, as well. Sadly, a good percentage of the food I selected happened to be cold, resulting in 4 stars, instead of the 5 I wanted to award.

tpbU9UpT76mGqWjszqYACw.text: I decided to try out this buffet because Paradise Buffet at the Fremont was closed.. The all you can eat was $29.. ouch... but the saving grace was The prime rib - which was off the charts!!!!!!! I ate like a beast... Seafood: clams, mussels, crab legs, shrimp, etc!! Padifilo was my server, and provided awesome service! The ladies at the front desk was also friendly and we shared laughs! Well that's my review! poorman 4 stars on this joint!

855pWBE0EpNScRqoQVRpJA.text: What a scam. Website says $14.99 for lunch per person. But when you get there it is $15.99 a person. While a $1.00 may not seem like much but take this in mind. When I talked to the hostess she said it's been that way for over a year and they haven't changed the website. I wonder how many Tens of thousands of people have been overcharged in the process?

CMMfzULKp8vNVjoL18fGuQ.text: Been here twice. Once for dinner and most recently for breakfast. During both visits there was a long line that wrapped around to the escalator. Price isn't bad.   For breakfast, the buffet provided cereal, oatmeal, fruit, bread, and an assortment of meat. Highlight of the meal was the ham. Nice and juicy! (Usually I dont like  ham because they tend to be dry.) Tried the oatmeal. It wasn't anything special. The bagel was your typical bagel. However the cream cheese was pretty tough to even scoop out, let alone spread.  As for the service (yes there is service at a buffet!), it was slow. I was nearly done with my first plate before the waitress appeared to ask us what we like to drink.  Would I come here again? Probably not. But if they gave me a voucher for a free meal, sure I'll use it ;)

EtXwXsaAkwP0IscNDaftIw.text: Been here about 3 times. The staff are super friendly and accommodating. Its always clean the only downfall is theres only about 8 tables along the window that gives a view of the amazing pool and shark tank. The buffet has the basic offerings of meat station, soup/salad bar, seafood and desert. The sections are small but are kept clean and well stocked. The only thing i didn't like was they heat lamps. There was a race to fill my plate and get to the table to eat before it got cold. I had the lobster mac which was a disappointment it tasted like box mac n cheese with imitation lobster and un-toasted panko crumbs. However collard green crab legs and cold shrimp were good! Only thing missing is burgers n fries for the kiddos

uJHAk9QG8p6sYURYwzVO9A.text: We most likely won't come back. The servers had no idea what gluten free was, so let's hope I survive the ride home tomorrow. Food wasn't very good, we just want to get back out on the strip

Y_QABF_TQr6Ip_uyZcfRvA.text: I love buffets and I enjoyed this one. The fried chicken and Chinese food were my favorite and it's cheaper than other buffets. If I'm in downtown Vegas again, I will definitely come here again.

QtFDGqebzPHL3qEPcYBocQ.text: Blech, do yourself a favor and go to ANY of the buffets on the Strip and you'll get a better bang for your buck. Not worth it.

1pxGvE8ewKyxaJojh25-lw.text: It's got a lot of Sysco food on the bar, but it's pretty good for hang over food. The mimosa revived me, our server dropped off a huge carafe of coffee and made sure we were hydrated mama bear style. She joked a little, which was appreciated.  The food isn't bad, but it's not five star like some of the buffets. That's ok, because they don't charge five star prices.  It's a buffet like most buffets you've been to. Maybe a little better. But not the top tier. If you're staying in the hotel, it's a good spot. It's not a go out of your way place. It is a place of convenience, when you're lazy, hung over and checking out like we were.  But I like that, my boyfriend and my little situational adventures. Bloody Mary's that are spicy. Pineapple juice, and the offer of refills.  Fudge, I was going to give this place three stars, but that suggests it's bad. And it's not. It just is. The flux and flow of tourism. The changing hands of time. People have to work. In vacation, you need to eat.  Four stars friend.

g9S9rODzXksFf26sTOJgjQ.text: I was here on 10/03/16 and give them 4 stars for the options of food I could select from. The food varied from chicken and smashed potatoes ,Chinese food, pizza, build your own salad, couple options for meat, small selection of sushi and customized made to order omelette or pasta option which I really enjoyed. One of the chefs made me delicious fettuccine and lasagna . They didn't have a wide selection in desert but the service and attentive friendly staff made up for it. I would recommend and bring your appetite the food was very tasty.

oihGRpeVCOORTkd2Jg8dzA.text: Best Buffett for the cost that I saw in Vegas. The food and fruit was all fresh and the drinks, other than alcohol, were included for $15.99. A well worth it price. If you want to travel to Fremont street, start off early and get breakfast here. You won't regret it. The buffet also has a great view of the pool. They make fresh omelette as well, my favorite part.

yQ0YqzX70fRReCvGINmbLQ.text: All different types of food, great enviornment, the servers are nice, the food tastes great, the deserts are deadly. Totally reccomend.

0QOkMPR1SO4Rm1kJ0rLp1A.text: Good cheap breakfast. Small selection of food for a buffet.  Service was a little slow to get drinks, I had to flag someone down. The restaurant is really dark.

Fbw1yg6h98VgZv6iP9NWRQ.text: "Still pretty good"  We've been eating breakfast here for years. They have been cost cutting a few corners, but holding the price, which is commendable. Eggs cooked to order, several breakfast meats, bagels and lox, fresh fruits, pastries, etc. What else do you want for eleven bucks?

7Adq2rEiO08wKnuZan5y9g.text: This place is the reason why the old downtown is dying.   The food is despicable! Stale, stale and stale are the only three words I can think of  Some of the items I dare not eat much less touch as they look more than two days old!   I want my money back!  It cost about $25 per person, a total rip off  We went this past Sunday afternoon  The servers have the most sour face I have ever seen at las Vegas   I honestly believe that this place is a huge harm for Golden Nugget. Just close it !

v5liVde3-r-lgbjEf7Krnw.text: Since moving to NV, my husband and I are trying all of the buffets..Golden Nugget seems to be our default place when we can't decide on one. Its nice and simple, clean and friendly. Food is pretty good, nothing orgasmic and its reasonibly priced. Kids enjoy it too.

0kkdpGHQF3vkG73gLhV_rA.text: I would like to say you get what you pay for, but even at $18+ on a Saturday for lunch is way overpriced. The lunch here was like hospital food. The service was awesome, but the food was pretty bad. I ended up sick from the salad dressing which possibly went bad. Shit, I avoided everything else but still got it from the dressing. No wonder this was the only buffet in Vegas with no line. I should of just had bread, at least it was pretty decent.

INsg3mSClRYX2HZAY7hnzg.text: It was soooo good especially with pretty cheap prices. Staff was very friendly too. Except the tortilla man. He was kind of mean. The food isn't some cheap cafeteria food, but as you can expect it's not 5-star dining. It's pretty reasonably priced. Love this place; wish I could bring it back home with me.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Nugget Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tPQqW0gOU8EsRReACQvaoA.text: We went for Sunday Brunch paid close to $50 for two people.  I was so disappointed.  The cashiers were unfriendly and couldn't even pretend to crack a smile. The food was below average at best.  The scrabbled eggs were sitting in an inch of water and looked slimy.  When we remarked about the eggs to one of the cooks, we were ignored.  We asked for orange juice and received orange pop.  I won't go back and I recommend you stay away.  It's not worth it.

o50VqCCsP3-clZHe4CGmnA.text: The Lunch Buffet -$12   Even though it was Veterans Day & several local places were offering FREE Buffets for Vets (like myself) including the Main Street Station Casino right around the block, this was not on my agenda and I proceeded forward to try this one.   It didnt start off well as the elevator door kept opening up even though nobody was there to get on & it wasnt going down. So I took the escalator down to the gift shop & bought a paper & went back up to the buffet on the 2nd floor. NBD.   Then, once seated, there was the issue wt the lighting once again and I asked to be moved to a place wt better light so I could read my paper. I was gladly moved to a seat next to the full window overlooking the pool and its Aquarium, VERY COOL!! However, I did notice that at the pool ALL the guest were laying directly on the lounge pads & NO towel was being offered or laid out for them. I'm surprised as this is VERY unsanitary. Whatever, I'm not going there and laying on someone elses sweat & suntan lotion mess & its .NOT my problem.  At $12 it was a little pricey for lunch but FINALLY this buffet selections actually had some flavor to it, unlike the previous reviewed buffet. The Collard greens actually had real bacon in them and were very good & required no salt at all. The Beef Teriaki wt brocoli was actually "over sauced" & to rich but when mixed wt the Pepper, Onions & beef/chicken was very good and the perfect mix of all the ingredients blended together. And while there was no sushi (insert sad face here), there was shrimp cocktail wt medium sized pealed shrimp and a crab salad, both of which were not bad at all.  Also the Shreded  BBQ beef was very good and full of flavor. I didnt try the fried chicken or anything  from the carving station but it all looked real good and of a high quality.  The waitstaff didnt seem that friendly & helpful as my water glass went empty for quite sometime as they all casually walked by until a nice oriental lady offered to refill it even asking me if I wanted something else to drink . I didnt, but thanked her just the same.  The desert station wasnt that impressive and seemed to offer alot of mini cream puffs, cheesecakes, & the likes. I wasnt impressed at all and when I asked the lady scooping the ice cream what flavor one was she had no idea. LOL! I had a scoop anyway and I have NO IDEA what it was either (Maple? Butter Pecan? Carmel???) but it was good with a half slice of mini pecan pie.   Overall I'd say that out of the 3 buffets downtown, for lunch, this is the best and the table views overlooking the pool & aquarium rock and must really be sensational at night!!

YLVNBYOKhN_oe3zmNgrWww.text: Ok folks, here's the deal. We paid $18.99 for dinner (each). We were starving...and only able to eat the pizza and chicken salad. The salad bar looked good but we didn't want salad. The roast beef had no flavor, the "salisbury steak" was grizzly and couldn't be chewed easily. You have to peel your shrimp, the chinese food was oil coated with gobs of salt for flavor. Really, the pizza wasn't bad but just limited choices of cheese, peperoni or sausage.  My mom is in her 60's and I in my 40"s, and both agreed after more than 35 years of buffetting in Vegas...this was the worst for quality and price. We aren't that picky, but you can get much much better for a heck of a lot less. My advice is go anywhere else...you can't do much worse for this price.

JMur6XXpfATbC_ez7mDjZw.text: We met up with some Hawaii relatives here for the Saturday Champagne Brunch.  I liked it because of the extra brunch offerings.   I'm usually not a fan of breakfast buffets because it's usually the same ol' heavy standard breakfast foods.  Everyone went the usual route of eggs, waffles, breakfast meats, etc. They all went to get custom-made omelets.  Normally, I would have been right there with them getting my favorite spinach-mushroom omelet but got distracted by other offerings in some of the other stations.  I went for the veggie mixes and was delighted to find a goat cheese-grape tomato mix.  (This was the main dish for me!)  Also had some grilled fish (mahi mahi?).  There were several sugar-free breakfast desserts to tempt me, but went with the yogurt-granola mix.  The lady serving our table took really good care of us.   Since it was still really early, there weren't too many other diners. So the atmosphere was pretty relaxed & enjoyable. I actually wouldn't mind coming back here.

SaSJcaPPV-WWAGmwhnnKxA.text: Good price. Nice dining room. Great variety of food. We went right as breakfast was ending so we had the chance to try both breakfast and lunch. Best things to try are the bacon, omelettes, and ice cream :)

guVC2TWfd8229mkVQU5RvQ.text: It's alright. I've had better buffets but there was plenty of food to choose from. The place was clean but the food was just....alright. There was prime rib, sea food, some pizza, pasta, salad fixings, and sweets. I just don't think that the price is a bargain. The service was fine when we went. Drinks and re-fills came quickly.

kxf23BRJwU3sAbLA9ps-BQ.text: I only had one meal here.  Breakfast.  And one of my favorite breakfast buffet offerings has to be corned beef hash.  And the Nugget Buffet's corned beef hash  was some of the best I've ever had!  Anywhere!  I went back for seconds, thirds AND fourths!

9UXBYcx-SmwT0awcZ3nVdA.text: Just not very good. Seems like the chefs are not very skilled. Everything cooked tastes the same. There was not a big selection either. There are crab legs and some mussels but that's about it.

U-CFomjv6fQ2nmVD-V_g8w.text: We did the breakfast buffet.  Um, really save your money and go into Claim Jumper.  This Buffet is HORRIBLE.  The bacon was limp, sausage tasted like it was cooked 2 days ago, the french toast was like chewing on a tire, eggs runny.  On the other hand, the ham at the cutting station was very good.  Now don't get me wrong cause I like a buffet, but this one is truly worth missing.

1U0_gY0tGdpyGs9sks493A.text: We were in downtown looking for a place to eat, we had the buffet years ago and it was ok, so we decided to give it a try for dinner.   I have to say were were very pleasantly surprised, this was much better than any buffet I have had in the past.   There was a large variety of food, mostly seafood but plenty for those of us that don't eat seafood. They had a baked chicken that was so moist and flavorful, I had to go back twice.   They also had your carving station with Turkey, beef and ribs, served with grilled veggies. Wonderful.. A build you own pasta bar was good, but be careful, it was a large serving.   The waiter was excellent, right on it with drinks and clearing plates.   The food was very fresh for buffet food, nothing seemed to be sitting for very long.. everything had that homemade taste..   I was so full I didn't get to try the dessert, they had a wonderful selections of cakes, eclairs and ice cream you could get on the cone or in a dish.

8juXOZTXvsbd-GN6BI4z3w.text: I got a great meal for the price I paid. I hate seeing reviews talking about how sub par the buffet is, but, Hello! It's not a $30 buffet. I paid $10.99 for breakfast and also got to sample some lunch items. I really enjoyed the French toast and eggs, along with the various pastries that I took a few nibbles of. I also got unlimited refills of orange juice and milk. I would definitely go back again! I would like to try lunch or dinner. The pizza they made was delicious and you can't go wrong with a scoop of ice cream to complete your meal.

mRNH2KDjIHPODlLJBpB7Vg.text: Had the Monday night dinner buffet. Was very disappointed. Used a 2-for-1 coupon and still thought it overpriced. The place reminded me of a hospital cafeteria.

VFvJKb_LlDOsVu94_VEIYA.text: Not bad. I would call this right down the middle for a Las Vegas Buffet. They had all the standard fare like Prime Rib, Ribs, and King Crab Legs. Not the widest variety but friendly staff. Decent price.

gci-tV628-oyaWY7pYP5DQ.text: A little pricey at $27 a person on a friday night but hands down the best buffet on fremont street. The food is fresh and prepared well every time i have been there. I go about twice a year.  The people who work there are on the ball keeping plates cleared off the table and drinks filled

-nh4wUH1_F0mFVus3PDb0w.text: Customer service was ok but the food was not all that great maybe if price was 13 or maybe 14 bucks. The ham was dry and the brisket was a lil to red but it had an ok taste. The biscuits and gravy had like no taste what so ever! Lol  I would never eat here again!

OTnCJbt_axm4EihcwnBVhw.text: I travel to Las Vegas often and tend to try the buffet at the hotel I stay at. It's a given that not everything will be stellar but there is normally one item that I particularly enjoy. Not this time. I was so hoping for something that I even had dessert and I admit the cannoli were above par. The server, Maria, was outstanding.

zmLwB-TJ0oNNjMfzQ5EAfA.text: The Golden Nugget, where do i begin. The cashier needed my wife's id when her credit card has her picture on it and she said that the reason it was needed is because it's Nevada Law(kind of smart ass). 2nd the manager Adriane (i beleive) told us that the id is needed because a lot of transients have been coming to the restaurant lately.(Is she calli g us transients or is she simply stupid). 3rd my daughter's deser had something unexplainable. The manager could not explain or keep her cool. very rude and arragant african american lady. Poor choice of words..

Rk4VpNI5GOwAG0jixftF8w.text: This review is based only off of the breakfast buffet. There were plenty of options to choose from, everything you would expect and nothing more. I enjoyed my breakfast and it was a pretty affordable option compared to many other buffets.

ZJt2ipXjNT3h5vNIZY8IeA.text: A very decent buffet for the price since we had 2 for 1 coupons. Two complete buffets for $16. Can't go wrong with that price. I devoured a nice salad, prime rib, and peel-n-eat shrimp. Also a slice of the sub sandwich, but had to peel off the top crust for fear of breaking a tooth. All n all a nice experience with great hostess and servers.

lzbU4zZt97JM6smCR8aBog.text: Service was great. Our waiter Bobby was very attentive to us. I came here because of the memories of Old Vegas. Yes the buffet may not be as lavish as the others, but the food was good and i liked many of the items.  Very warm staff and smiles all around.  So many people do not know how Vegas began. Yes the Northern Strip is all the hype, but places in Old Vegas are landmarks.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Nugget Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our food....

Ig4sOQiqn3-XdRbxfrAdZA.text: Ate here yesterday for the last time after over 10 years of one of my favorite buffets downtown. I lifted the metal lid off of the cream of mushroom soup and it was so hot that I had to set it down on the counter next to the pot. I scooped my soup into a bowl and I went to replace the metal lid back onto the pot but it was just so extremely hot that I automatically let go and the whole lid fell to the bottom of the mushroom soup. The woman behind the counter did see it all and came over while I apologized and she stuck her hand into the pot of cream of mushroom soup, retrieve the lid, wiped it off from A towel on the back counter and replaced it back on top of the pot. I mentioned to her she should not be serving that soup to anyone because it's now contaminated with the lid and your hand. She just ignored me and walked away. What else do they do that we don't catch? I know it happens  at all restaurants But when a customer catches it, they usually rectify it. I emailed the hotel and I left a message with the buffet manager because I was told there was not one on duty at the time. Have not heard a word back. Be careful. Be safe.

MWWAw7t-n02CVpqO4u4DJw.text: We came here for breakfast which is $22, no discount for a players card unless you have gambling points to use.  The timing actually ended up to be perfect since we were able to get breakfast and some lunch since they were switching.  Plenty of options and we all left full.

EJduXG-VExKzYPRf9bWirA.text: Went there for Thanksgiving dinner ate the turkey it was just ok not turkey meat off the bone but because I eat dark meat I had to deal with it  Seems  to be a turkey roll  So I went up to get desert and reached for a piece of cherry pie and a running cockroach came running across the desert bar Ill never eat there again this place can't be clean I can imagine how dirty the kitchen is,

MNoKH6HKgzdahumnRvI8Lw.text: Great buffet. Surprisingly good for a casino.  We came just as lunch started and we're so surprised at the quality of the food.  They still had an omelet bar going which had very good omelets, they guy took his omelets seriously.  Our waiter, Clinton, was the most polite and attentive server we have ever had at a buffet.  It felt like we were being served by an English butler.   Shout out for the orange chicken, the omelettes, the roasted chicken very tender and moist. I loved their mac & cheese, and I think I am a mac & cheese snob.  My brother-in-law who works in the food industry said that they are using very good quality food.  Only a few of the items were not as fantastic, but they were still very tasty, just not as good as some of the others. Overall an excellent buffet.  Thank you Clinton for your excellent service.

jR_xW5D_JvS8jkm1e9MHDg.text: Golden Nugget Buffet - 5 stars  Location: Golden Nugget Casino second floor. Take the escalator up like you're going to see Gordie Brown. But don't.  Atmosphere: The line to get in moves fast. Laid back and casual. Nice view of the pool if you choose to sit near the windows.  Cleanliness: No issues. Never had a dirty glass or piece of silverware here. The buffet is kept up and very clean.  Service: Diane is the best! We've been here about a dozen times and had her as our server every time. She's attentive, fun, easy-going, and brings you a smile when she brings you another mimosa. Love this girl a lot.  Food/Drinks: Bottomless mimosas. Need I say more? Seriously the best mimosas downtown. Champagne Brunch on Saturdays and Sundays for only $17. The meat carving station and the omelet station are both worth the wait. Really nice prime rib. The garlic chicken and spring rolls are my favorites for lunch and the eggs and corned beef hash are my faves for breakfast. Average salad selection, but you can throw together your own Caesar if you're feeling adventurous. The Dreyers Chocolate ice cream is truly the best ice cream ever. I'm not a big pastry fan, but if that's your bag, you'll probably like the selection. They have a ton of cookies and pastries to choose from. And they have this bread pudding with bourbon sauce that is pretty tasty. But let's be totally honest here. I come for the meats, eggs, and mimosas.  Price: Inexpensive. Especially if you play poker and get the comp. Play cards at their poker room for four hours and receive a $10 voucher to redeem at either the grill or the buffet. I recommend the buffet.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Nugget Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Golden Nugget Buffet: Spring rolls and garlic chicken. So good.
Photo of Golden Nugget Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Golden Nugget Buffet: Salad bar.
Photo of Golden Nugget Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Golden Nugget Buffet: Bottomless Mimosas! Yay!

NXnrg9bjTMlP571S1VTNyw.text: My experience is for a breakfast buffet. I must say it was a little overpriced but it was pretty decent for a Fremont buffet. My husband and I  enjoyed the omelette bar. I will come back to try their dinner if I ever go back to Fremont street.

whEIr25rZGRcHrLmNydTdQ.text: Visited on a Monday holiday. Eeeh.  Very small selection of options. Food seemed oooolddd. The only good food was the chicken but i could of gone to el pollo loco for that. Desert looks good but does not taste as good as it looks. Waiter was nice and keep coming to give refills thats why 2 stars instead of 1.

pBhV3OC1W-ajbSEQj84xkQ.text: This is a very bare bones buffet.  I was staying at the hotel and was reading their magazine in my room and saw it said they had crab!  I thought to myself, how awesome, I can stay in my hotel tonight and grab dinner without having to leave.  When my mother and I walked downstairs, we immediately new something was amiss, it was dinner time and the place was not packed!  Also, the ad in the magazine said crab, there wasn't any crab.  There were deserts, and to be honest, those are always hit and miss at any buffet.  They had sandwiches which was very weird, I've never seen sandwiches at a buffet.  The selection o food was very small, some prepared salmon and chicken dishes.  I ate primarily all the veggie dishes.  I was very upset because my mom rarely goes on vacation and this was a two night trip in which day one's dinner was a complete fail.  We didn't get our money's worth and with the prestige of the Golden Nugget we were expecting a far better dinner experience.  The only positive thing about this experience was the fact I could use my $15 food credit here and get the points loaded to my Landry's card.  I hope management really gets a hold on this place because they can be lining people up by the number to get in here, Vegas is synonymous with buffets, they could be the leader downtown.

MVLWSl_DW2IcosGTC3JLhA.text: I do not want to give this place any stars. Unfortunately I have to because it will not let me not choose zero stars. We paid too much money for not a large option of good. The food was over cooked, not seasoned, very bland. The creme brulee was not good at all. The top was not torched to make the sugar on the top hard and crunchy. It was a bourbon sauce and the bourbon was not cooked out of it so it was terribly bitter. I definitely do not recommend this restaurant. We will not be eating here again.

w_M1g9TLlQ_RvMBeRou31w.text: Came here one evening. We got lucky that it was seafood night so it cost $25 a person.  Food was worth the price.  It was not so busy and the food was always refreshed.  The staff was nice, friendly and attentive.     They gave us a bucket to put all out seafood shells in. Very convenient.  I wish they had wet wipes to clean up after though.  The dessert bar was awesome.  They have fresh whole pies and a server to give you real ice cream on a cone.    They had plenty of meat dishes and sushi but I stayed away. Too filling.  They also had crab mac and cheese.    We stayed about 3 hours.  Next time I would like to try their mimosa lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Nugget Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Nugget Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Golden Nugget Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fmbRollBGpTDeidYI3bBYA.text: My husband and I celebrated Thanksgiving by eating at the buffet.  We had dined there a few years ago on Thanksgiving and the employees, including the cashier, the cooks, and the servers all seemed angry and rude so we stopped coming to your buffet.  Today it was wonderful.  Everyone was smiling!  We want to make a point of complimenting our server Carol from Pittsburg.  She was fast, efficient, and always smiling.  The ice cream dipper Michael Berryhill was so much fun that I think I'd come back to the buffet just for the ice cream service.  I noticed the employees were also nice to each other.  They were all moving so fast, I think they'd do well in a Nascar race and they never ran into each other or into any of the oblivious but happy diners.  There was plenty of Thanksgiving entrees to choose from.  I do think some of the warm foods could be a bit warmer.  The desserts actually tasted as good as they looked!  Thank you for making our Thanksgiving dinner experience perfect.  We are locals so we have tried many of the buffets in town.

4qalKl-gnWY7zsvOg2GvtA.text: This is by far the worst buffet we have ever been to; there aren't many selections; prime rib was over cooked! (Nooo! why you wanna mess up prime rib like that!?!) Other meats were dry as well. The only thing that was delicious was the coconut cream pie, but not worth $30!  Very few selections Poor quality Over-priced Crowded in seating area; tables too close together

qkPZbFAy5tQTqz7Uj2DoUg.text: The worst buffet i ever been to ever the food was horrible the price was high because of a convention that was in the strip. i had guests with me that visited down town for the first time and i doubt if they wanna go there ever again. I chose that buffet because i thought the golden nugget is the best casino in down town and i know i made the most horrible choice for me and my guests. And i will never ever step a foot in that casino ever again. Old food that would make u throw up i had only salad because i was starving. Shame on such a hotel to have such a service

tbPHfx3eXOGGDYtT4uuyBg.text: It's an adequate buffet, if only just.  Not the largest selection, heck not a large selection period. But there's a bit of sushi, roast beef, two kinds of sausage, chicken, salad, pasta and omelet bars, a decent amount of dessert...  Price and decor reflect its status as well. Decidedly modest... but at least there was no wait.

igpt1oXH2XuL7JYuNvY7Lg.text: buffet is overpriced, even for the prime rib.  desserts were the best. the creme brulee and the peanut butter dessert in the small plastic 45 degree angle see-through tubes were awesome

QLsTfdOV4Hh4OzgpwDJAsQ.text: Vegas is known for it's buffets but I was not impressed with the Golden Nugget Buffet. I called ahead to arrange seating for a wedding party of 15-20 people. When we got there we ended up having to sit at two different tables but I wil admit the wait time was less than 5 minutes.   Our drink orders were taken within 3 minutes and we were off to check out the buffet. And what I found was a very limited selection of items, in fact I will go so far as to say this was the most limited selection buffet I've been into in Vegas to date. But the thing that irritated me the most was that several of the stations had empty trays. As in no food. Some new items came out by the time we went back to check it again but it was too little, too late.   The live stations were also a disappointment. The meat carver was working with a ham that was about gone by the time we got there. And 2 other stations were unstaffed. But it got worse. The ham was tough to chew, and the sushi, beyond missing some tags to indicate what kind of rolls were being served was tough to bite into. In fact one could buy better, more edible sushi at your local Smith's than you would find here.   I honestly REGRET that I chose this buffet for the wedding party we were with, and there is no way, absolutely NO WAY I can recommend this buffet. The Golden Nugget has always been a good experience for me in the past, but I hope to never grace their 2nd floor buffet with my presence ever again.

5TbC8FfFkH91fB6Oz5iGtw.text: The price is okay, food was really uneventful and bland, and very small not a lot of options. Golden Nugget Buffet I would expect something grander than we saw.

--N-PeMg6RjkA-n9veLb6Q.text: The food is decent, good variety. Hot Crab legs were real dry (that's why I only gave  them 4 stars) , chilled crab legs were great.   Desserts were amazing.  The server (Clinton) deserved 10 stars. Best service I've had in years. He should be promoted.

f3QfcZsjxwx-DoODFkj9Fg.text: The buffet food was at standards for vegas buffets, the desert options were endless, we went in for lunch and I love that they still offered omelettes.  The best part of the experience was our server Clinton, he was so welcoming and friendly as well as thorough customer service. If your in downtown Vegas check it out and don't forget to stop by The Shark Tan Swimming Pool!

9mDyW08Oqi54hgidFBxVAQ.text: The food was gross. Crab over cooked, paid way to much for gross over cooked food. Will never go again.

qzUWXcezXDyhzcjMFgBLpw.text: This morning I was looking to have a wonderful breakfast at this buffet. I have been here before and had never had an issue with servers till now. This waitress named Pamela had the most shitty attitude I have ever experienced here. Her answer to "can u take these plates away please" was "can you wait I have drinks to deliver and you wanted coffee so I have to go make more". If this is her attitude to service people she really should not do this any more. I understand about having an hard day and she is tiered , and elderly but so early in the morning and the place is not even full enough to call it busy just makes me feel unattended for and she has no people skills. Making her seem incompetent and she was very rude. Will not be coming here again along with my party of 23 people have been told as well.

sA05Qh4NijC7uAeHCMzDHw.text: Their buffet is pretty good too. It isn't the biggest I have seen, but they made up for it with quality food and neat little extras (homemade smoothies for breakfast!).   Yes, this isn't the show-stopping buffets that you expect to see in Las Vegas, but it doesn't come with the show-stopping price. It was about $12 a person and if you are lucky and have a buy one get one coupon, it is even cheaper. Six bucks for AYCE? That isn't bad. The trick is, stay at the hotel and they will give you coupons to eat at their restaurants.

Lu_W78UpuvMkD6bay2WNxw.text: Seafood night on Friday shrimp crab legs good variety.  Clams oysters fish best seafood salad ever.  Friendly staff

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Nugget Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deserts

Yt8PASnX0URfCcQY9jfk9A.text: The Golden Nugget is a hotel located in Fremont Street area. It is considered old  Vegas. We decided to try this buffet for breakfast one morning the cost was $16 per person. The wait in the short line was the worst part of the entire experience. There were 3 people ahead of us and it took 30 minutes to pay and get seated. The breakfast buffet was rated as one of the best buffets in the city for breakfast.  The  food was plentiful, freshly made tasty and hot. They had hot cereals, pancakes, waffles, every breakfast meat you can think of and beverages were included in the price. There was a surcharge for alcoholic beverages. Our waitress was kind and attentive.  I enjoyed this buffet and actually liked it better than the other breakfast we tried in the area that had ala carte pricing for less quality. I would return to this buffet

photos.caption: Photo of Golden Nugget Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Items from golden nugget bk buffet

MS7qsUqxQlSu-trKjtMdFA.text: I believe the Golden Nugget Buffet is one of the best on Freemont. They've a great section of different types of food. We went on a Sunday, which was only $25.99 and it was Prime Rib night. One of the best tips to give is to go around 3:30pm because that is when they change from Brunch to Dinner. You will definitely get fresh dinner food! The waiter was also quick to take our finished plates, which I loved. The only negative outcome is that there was not a great section of seafood. They need more!  It is just right... not too fancy!  Atmosphere: 5/5 (Great view of the pool) Price: 4/5  Food: 4/5 (Need more seafood) Customer Service: 5/5

Xv9uI2JxYiphbx9eRX48CA.text: This was HORRIBLE !!! A Huge Rip Off !!! Not at all worth the $23.99 we paid per person.   So disappointed on every level. Dry carved red meat ( were calling it red meat because we don't really know what kind of meat it is.   The woman I got some pasta from actually pulled a DIRTY SPOON out of the sink to scoop it...and she acted  " put out " that I wanted some pasta !  The Server , Phil was so sweet & he is the only reason we gave 1- Star !  I will never go back ! Ever!!!!

9gK_mC4lgfK8AFrxkmuaVw.text: Roast beef very tough, ribs very dry. Mashed potato thick and sticky. If I had to do again would pass.

zo8ilv23IxheErXNQb0TDQ.text: Wow - I don't understand how this place does not have higher stars.  I ate here when I got married 8 years ago (before I ever had YELP - did it exist back then?) I loved it then!    Now as I stay at the Golden Nugget - AGAIN, I'm eating here again.   Lunch, Dinner, YUM I love this place.    The food is amazing.  The variety is awesome, and the price - unbelievable!!!  If you are staying at the Golden Nugget, or you are even at Fremont Street, go to the elevators, or take the escalator and go treat yourself to a great buffet for an amazing price!

Ej7pCFy2hQ8FdkUG2gHa-Q.text: This is a Fave on top of my Faves. There is just so much good food to choose from and the presentation is Fabulous! It's on the $$ side but we only live once or so we know, so why not Eat the Best when possible!

6kmSysWsLjMIeHF6pJp5qQ.text: you would think they would have a good buffet but they do not. i was underwhelmed. beef brisjet was dry. dinner selection was so limited. you had asian, italian and carvings.   you pay $29 w tax but you realize for what? Not worth it. Better to go Main buffet even if it ain't my favorite. that bad basically.    outdated resto, needs rennovation.   Front line reception service was good and friendly.   Unfortunately, this will be the first and last time we heading to eat at this place.

HmHc964trtLVduXRNBjg6Q.text: Overpriced for a very small, ordinary buffet. Some foods were cold or were in really small portions. For example, mini pancakes & waffles. I've never seen anything like that offered at a buffet. Just keep looking.

L44evpulrWLEZUNQR_3dHw.text: Not a great spot for foodies, picky eaters, adventurous palates or people who don't love the American food profile, but better than other buffets in the area.  During our recent stay in Vegas, my spouse and I came here twice for what was essentially brunch in the mid-afternoon. They've usually got a red meat roast on the carving station, along with something I wouldn't eat, like a roast turkey or some ham.   They have a little Chinese food and a little Mexican food, but nothing very good, very spicy or very interesting. There's the usual breakfast fare- eggs, bacon, sausage kind of stuff. I don't eat any of that really, but my hubs did and he said it was fine.   Now that I mention it, I think that word basically sums this buffet up nicely. It's fine.  It's not great. It's not spectacular, but it's just fine, especially if you're able to take advantage of a half price coupon Monday through Friday. :-)

wNaKwqmGBAgnp47jLmF3Ng.text: I was pleased. Good food for the price. I started with the carving station (pork tenderloin, sausages) and then hit the sides. It's a buffet, not gourmet, but it all tasted hot and fresh. Nice selection of pies for dessert too. I'd come back.

wjQdFKfBaDtBDN0j3qTbAw.text: Just a little of info on this place. It is way too expensive and kinda run down for what they have to offer. The variety seems like a lot to choose from but it really isn't. The food itself was not good. The bread looked dry and like it had been out for awhile. I tried some of the  corn beef hash, I had never tried it before because it has never looked good enough for me to eat, but this time it actually did but I must say I give it a 5/10. It was seasoned with way too much cumin. That was seriously all I tasted. So no. The employees were friendly but they kind of took too long to bring anything. I must say, the orange juice was freshly squeezed and that was the best part of it. I just look at it like I paid way too much for a cup of orange juice. I will not be going here again. :(

GGRZT3eTMZ20Vmri9krhxg.text: It took us 20 minutes to be seated.  The food on the buffet was not very good, and the selection was limited.  The service was rude, and the server tried to give us drinks well before we were finished because her shift was over.  We regretted spending our money here.

QRckj4_Rvgz9gGU-4yY42Q.text: Food not so great and they were out of stuff.  There are a lot of other places to go. Some of the people serving... the omelette guy for instance was very rude.  the carver guy scared me, but he was harmless. sorry..I can't recommend

BJVKiei4q-aH8jzPjYZGrg.text: This was a very average buffet. It wasn't bad, but I think I got my moneys worth more  in champagne than anything else. They kept refilling my glass with mamosa's and I was not about to tell them no. The environment is cool and staff is friendly, but not my first choice for a buffet.

e81va_fIMV0-wwWhFw8EJg.text: I rarely write reviews, but this was THE worst buffet my husband and I have ever had in Vegas. To be honest, the food was so forgettable that I can't even remember what we ate, but there wasn't a single item that either of us had where we could say, "mmm, that's good."  At $20 per person, I expected a lot more. Don't waste your money here. The buffet at Main Street Station blows this place away in price, selection and taste.

zaUoffK6Pxy5f6b7d5h_2g.text: They had everything you should have, but everything was sub par.  Tatter tots and biscuits (for gravy) were ROCK hard - like crumbled, that hard.  Waffles were soft.  The only fruit is cantaloupe and melon.  The omelet was good, and the bacon was crisp, that was the saving grace.  Service friendly but not great; it took a long time to get drinks, we didn't get refills and a manager had to bus our plates.  The main cashier was RUDE, and would not speak to us.  Literally zero words, we asked her questions about our coupon and using our Laundry's card together, and she would not even look at us.  Just told us the total.  It was weird, not gonna lie, felt like we were beneath her to even answer our questions.  There was a long line and she took the card, so we just moved on but it sucked to be treated that way.  It was really crowded too, but only because it was hard to know what line to get in to get food.  It was a crowd around one area, then dash to go next; everyone was polite but no one ever knew who was next or what you were waiting for (omelet station to the left, scrambled eggs to the right, syrup to the middle....ayyy).  Even with a 2-1 coupon from the hotel,  this isn't worth it.  I'm on vacation, why eat gross food with bad to terrible service?

HrwmsyGl7J30OMEwqVUsYg.text: If you have a coupon or you are already in the Freemont Street area this place is good eats at a pretty decent price.  All of the food is tasty, though nothing is high dollar and nothing is particularly unique.  The main problem here is that the buffet is pretty small, where you might find 5-6 large stations at a buffet on the strip, this place has 3 + Desert.  If you count the bread and salad island it's 4 but that is a stretch.  The staff is friendly and pretty attentive.  they could be around a little more but Every time they passed me they checked my glass so it was more that they didn't come by as much as I would like, I didn't get ignored.  The seating here as uncommonly comfy, the chairs were well padded and as a fat bastard I appreciate being comfy while I inhale astonishing quantities of food.  All in all it was a solid mid grade affair.  I would go again if I were in the area.

TEVF_4TWlhvF5KJfuvigHQ.text: If I could give it 0 stars I would! 21.99$ for the seafood and more buffet (the only dinner they have). For that price I thought that they would have a big selection. They have cold shrimp, muscles,and oysters; they were in water not ice and looked like they had been sitting out for at least 5 hours. Eek that's gross! I would spend the extra 5-6 dollars and go to the rio instead more food and it is defiantly safer to eat since they take more care of it as far as temp. Goes! I will never be back to this buffet! I guess ppl call it the toilet bowl buffet! Beware!

p9IH_aRDjAwM5EzCZV_kRQ.text: In the late 80's and the 90's, the Buffet at Golden Nugget was one of the best in town.  It's been a long, downhill slide since then.  Dinner tonight was skimpy, and most of the food tasted prepackaged.  I should have known: at 7 PM there was no line.  It used to stretch around the block.

BllowLRBkaZW3yQvmCRRyQ.text: Ok for brunch. Nothing blew me away as great or super tasty, but nothing was really bad either. Omelet station was a bit messy because so many people were trying to push their way in,  but other than that is s petty simple lay out. Carving station, salad bar,  dessert. Not a huge selection, but it was enough.  I didn't even eat dessert. It looked good,  had ice cream ready to scoop, bread pudding,  napoleon's, I just didn't want sweets. Server was nice,  brought refills quickly, cleared plates. Tables were clean. Restrooms just outside and close to restaurant.  The sign to get in was a bit misleading because it said something about vip cardholders when we waited by the cash register a guy told us to wait behind the ropes (we were the only ones in line) I pointed out I thought it was the vip line & he said he didn't know why the sign was there,  but he didn't take it out. Lol. He looked like mgmt to me! Must not have been his "job" to take out the sign.

JXoOgvJmjvD5rjQESs9YbQ.text: Stay away as far as you can from this buffet. Got food poisoning after eating at this place. Besides for the price they are charging, the food selection wasn't that good all. Stay Away.

u1GYMCAKcVv6662IYXFtjw.text: WEAK. For a "Nevada" casino buffett its week. TI's is better. Luxor's is better. PM's is better.  Why is it weak? There was very limited food selection.

qNqIRs1-_PpsxrTZSscN2w.text: Our taxi cab driver recommended this place to eat. He said it was the best bang for our buck, he quoted us about $12 or $13 for lunch, however, it proved to be False. It turned out to be over $20! Since we already commited to walking all those stairs, we decided to give it a shot since the ladies guarantee us that dinner was about to start and some good seafood was coming out.  Right when we sat down, our waitress greeted us with bottomless mimosas! We quickly turned our frowns upside down, nothing like a little booze to cheer up our wallets.   The food was so so, I just snacked a bit here and there because I wanted the dinner seafood selection. Raw oysters and crab legs! I was the first person to attacked the tray of oysters and something smelled a little fishy. Should realized it was a bad omen, but I continued down the line and got a plate of crab legs. The crabs were delicious, but the labor was just not worth it. After I finished up the legs I went for the oysters, it tasted a little off and warm. Needless to say, it didn't measure up to par so I stopped eating it. As I reached for my mimosa to wash down the weird taste, I noticed I was low on refreshment. I realized we switch waitress and that bottomless mimosas were only during lunch and not dinner. How disappointing...  Next morning, I woke up with intense stomach pain. I think those warm, odd tasting oysters were not settling well in my tummy. Never eat raw oyster at a buffet or not chilled on ice.

oHqYgRwWTV701yTxYUEUMQ.text: My sister and I are not usually to excited by the idea of buffett eating, but we new we had to try one whil ein Vegas over the weekend.  Since we were staying at the Golden Nugget we decided to try ther breakfast buffet this past Sunday.  We went in with a game plan- scope it out, and then make tiny plates, eat slow, and drink a glass of champaign in between eat plate of food.  We went early and got to sit near the windows overlooking the pool.  It was a good people watching spot.  I enjoyed everything there, (especially the omlet bar, and the turkey sausage dipped in syrup- sad to say though- I DIDN"T EAT ANY DESSERRTTTSSSS.  I was so full.

5GWqtyEgC2TN2Le56DPOfg.text: It's not the greatest nor is it terrible. It's a decent buffet. Came here during lunch. They had pretty good selections. $12.99 per person for lunch

r5thi5KHEHMHdtsHrN6Ohg.text: Ok, this is a review of the breakfast.  Don't waste your time.  Granted it only cost $8 with drinks, because of the coupon you receive when you check in.  I was not excited about any of it.  Pancakes were ok and omelets were watery.  Orange juice was good and fruit was fresh.  Nothing else looked appealing.  I'm giving two stars because I had a great view of the pool from my table.  Ask to sit on the window!
